Reviews.Title: “Not good on value”
Reviews.Author: Cha0tic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rate 4* but it is not that good. The rooms are relatively small. Generally clean but not spotless. Specific criticism: the room was not ready until 2pm and even then they only had a smokers room; the do not disturb sign is disregarded by the staff which steps into your room for checking the bar or bringing chcolates or checking if the room was cleaned - as if the guest were not there; our room faced a street where a cafe Beirut is open almost the entire night with noise, shouting etc going on for long periods of time ; then street cleaning starts at 6am. For nearly 300Eu a night - not a good choice. The location is perfect. Les Halles is being rebuilt so there is a lot of building noise around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lucasz_K
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for 3 nights and stayed in Novotel.I specialy like the decor of the place. Breakfast in the morning was deliciouse with a lot of choices and smileing verry helpful staff. We had absolutely amazing stay and definately want to came back there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel Les Halles or 5 nights pre Easter. Location was perfect - the local station, Chatelet Les Halles is a 1 minute walk and will get you directly to Eurodisney and all the major attractions in a flash. We travelled by Eurostar and recommend a cab from Gare du Nord however to avoid the escalators! During our stay my daughter was sick and the hotel sourced a doctor in 30 minutes on Easter Saturday and allowed us to stay late before we headed home so she could rest up. Brilliant! We had an executive and a superior room - both clean, modern and well maintained. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the kids balloon entertainer a treat. There is some work going on at Forum Les Halles but nothing to worry about - we strongly recommend this hotel and will stay again next visit. Well done all!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: francoise d
Reviews.Content: one of the best places clean friendly persons nice breqkfqst

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly, efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Shezza42
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends and I stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time. We shared a room for 3 and was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and adequate and there was a separate toilet which was a great idea. Location was excellent as we were around the corner from numerous choice of bars and restaurants, ranging from French to Japanese. The metro was right on our doorstep too, only a few stops from Eurostar but easily walkable too. Notre Dame and Louvre are easily in walking distance. I will defintely return with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: chubbycheekedlaura
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel Les Halles for six days March 22-28 2012. The location is very central. You can walk to Notre Dame or The Latin Quarter in 5-10 minutes, The Louvre is 5-10 minutes the other direction. There are several Metro stops literally outside the door. There is also a taxi stand 5 minutes away near Chatelet Metro stop. The room was clean and modern as is the hotel. We stayed with our 14 year old daughter and she had a sofa bed. Kids stay free. We had the free breakfast and it was good. There was a large selection of hot and old items. It does get crowded at 9:00-10:00. The staff was wonderful. They were friendly, kind and helpful. I want to give special thanks to The Concierge who checked us in. He bent over backwards to help us with directions and had our bags brought up etc. (I did not get his name but he has curly hair and a pronounced limp) he was a delightful person! There is major construction going on in back at the shopping center so ask for a quiet room near the front. I definitely plan on returning. Paris and it's people are lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - beautiful lobby!”
Reviews.Author: Grace B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location to see a lot of the popular sites in Paris. The hotel ambiance was good, and room was very clean and well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: BOFjones
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleasantly surprised by the luxurious and comfortable centrally located hotel, which far surpassed my expectations of a chain hotel in its size and atmosphere. The room was comfortable and quiet, immaculately clean, and with good storage and a pleasant bathroom. The staff were, without exception, polite, friendly and extremely helpful. I was given a code to connect my phone to the free wifi, and there were also two Mac computers in the lounges downstairs for short sessions. We were able to reprint our lost return boarding passes there with no charge. The communal areas were beautiful and tranquil, large and luxurious, while still being welcoming. There is a pleasant courtyard garden convenient for smokers. The breakfasts were a feast, and comprised a great variety of foods which kept us going for hours- a great advantage in a city so expensive to eat out in. My small criticism would be that the room was rather warm at night, but to be fair, I did not mention it at the time to the staff, who I'm sure would have been helpful and keen to check the air conditioning: they were very approachable and considerate. It made little difference to our sleep, as we were extremely tired from all the walking! I would have no hesitation in returning here, and would recommend it to anyone. I think the price was very reasonable for such great facilities in an unbeatable location right in the centre of Paris with a metro statio on the doorstep. I look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kenmags
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Novotel. The staff were very welcoming and check in was swift and efficient. Our room on the fourth floor was clean and overlooked the inside courtyard and so was quiet. The bathroom had a bath and a separate shower cubicle which was a bonus and the towels were plentiful. The toiletries were topped up each day along with the tea and coffee making facilities. We did not use any of the hotel facilities or dine in the dining room except for breakfast which had a varied choice. The staff who were on duty at breakfast were helpful and efficient and the breakfast room was also spotlessly clean. Overall we had a great stay. If you are travelling to the hotel from the Gard de Nord take line 4 and get out at station Chatelet, there are 3 exits but if you take the exit named Lingerie (I think I have the correct cupelling) you will be directly in front of the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: chycco77
Reviews.Content: First time at Novotel les halles Room very clean and with enough space (in Paris is not easy ti find spacious room !) Hall and restaurant nice with good service It's not cheap but it's really in the heart of Paris Miss a little spa... But very good

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: daniel g
Reviews.Content: I recently had to find a hotel in Central Paris that is quiet, clean and that adheres to the Stars it purports to have. I was really pleasantly surprised by this hotel, it offers excellent value for your money especially if you are a business executive or owner who watches his expenses.The receptionists and everyone really have been welcoming and very efficient. My flight brought me to Paris early in the morning, I arrived at the hotel at 8am. my experience with hotels is usually that they would not give you a room until noon or 2pm however in this Hotel I was checked in within five minutes and I had enough time to go to my room, relax, take a shower and then go to my meetings. This kind of hospitality does make a difference and I will come back. The room is modern, clean and decorated in refreshing manner that gives you a feeling of space. The amenities were excellent and the internet works and free and the hotel is located right next to the Metro, what else can you ask for when in Paris. I had a very good stay and enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say”
Reviews.Author: murrayandamanda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend. Fantastic location, you can walk everywhere, Seine, Notre Dame, Louvre, Rue de rivoli all minutes away. We walked there from gare du nord but it's only two stops on the RER. Cafes, shops, restaurants all on your doorstep, nice breakfast at Le Coeur Couronne close by for 7E if you're not on an inclusive rate or don't want to pay for the hotel breakfast (which looked good with plent of choice, and prob would set you up for the day, but is comparatively pricey. Hotel does do hot drinks and unlimited croissants at the bar until midday at weekends if you don't need the whole shebang. Our queen executive room was spacious by Paris standards, clean, with a comfy bed but no feather pillows. It was quite hot even with the aircon on, in fact the room seemed cooler when we turned the aircon off. Well stocked free minbar on our rate, which we were very pleasantly surprised to find was replenished each morning with whisky, biurbon, gin, beer, still and fizzy water, coke, orange juice, peanuts and chocolate. We were able to stick some fresh milk in there too Nespresso machine plus kettle and instant coffee and a variety of tea bags also supplied. Ice machine in the corridor. Loads of towels. Free wifi which worked well. All staff very pleasant, the guy who checked us in couldn't do enough for us, and we were confident that any query would be efficiently and professionally dealt with, but equally staff were not intrusive and left us alone to enjoy our stay. Would highly recommend. We booked a package with Eurostar but you can get good advance purchase rates using the novotel.com website.

Reviews.Title: “A solid hotel with minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: schmusimausi73
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in March 2012. Its location right next to the Métro station "Châtelet", and a short walk to the Louvre, makes it a great starting point for visiting Paris. Our room was tiny. We had a double bed plus a sofa bed for our son, which means there was barely space to walk left in the room. Everything was clean and furnished efficiently, to make the most use of the limited space. The bathroom was right next to one side of the double bed, it consisted of a tub, a shower stall and a sink. The toilet was in a separate room right next to the entry door. There was also a small "coffee station" opposite the toilet room: a Nespresso coffee machine, an electric water kettle, and a few Nespresso capsules as well as the necessary fixings for making a cup of tea. The minibar was placed under the coffee station, above the safe. I've read the recent reviews of this hotel, and see that some guests have complained of lumpy pillows - yes, that must be a valid complaint because our pillows were lumpy and uncomfortable as well. I think the filling consisted of small pieces of foam. A bit of a contrast to the nice and fluffy bath towels. Usually in hotels you will find thin, cheap looking towels and nice plump pillows. Here it was the other way round. Another reviewer complained of overheated room - that was the case with our room as well. We turned off the heating immediately upon arrival but the room remained too warm and stuffy. We resorted to sleeping with the window open (in March!) just to cool off a little and get some fresh air, which was not an ideal solution because there was a lot of noise from the street (ambulances, drunk people yelling at each other, traffic). One last gripe: in my booking, I requested a non smoking room. We were put in a SMOKING room, and only later realized, the whole FLOOR was a smoking floor (which explains the smell). So, beware, the 3rd floor is full of smoking rooms and if you are, as we are, non smokers, request a room on a different floor. Breakfast was served in the hotel restaurant. I don't know if what we experienced was a regular occurrence or a fluke, but on both mornings, there was a long line of hotel guests waiting to be seated before they could have their breakfast. The breakfast receptionist was clearly overwhelmed by the amounts of guests waiting. She definitely did her best, no complaints there, but it was obvious that the restaurant capacity was nowhere near enough. We arrived at breakfast at 9 AM and by 10 AM people were still queueing to be seated. The otherwise boring wait was somewhat alleviated by the presence of an entertainer, who tried his best to cheer little kids up by making balloon animals for them. The man was very nice and his balloon animals were a hit with our son. But the hotel management needs to address the issue of not having enough seats/tables for their guests. The breakfast itself was nice, there was plenty of food to choose from, both sweet and savoury to hot and cold. Another good point: the children's play area. There are some toys and two TV screens with game consoles for the kids. All in all, this is a nice enough hotel and we'd consider staying here again, on the condition that 1) we get a room on a non smoking floor, 2) the heating/airconditioning is fixed, 3) the pillows are upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “not a good start”
Reviews.Author: bruno1234Brussels
Reviews.Content: booked and paid my room months ago because I really need to stay here ,as I am running a seminar at the hotel.... got a phone call the day before scheduled arrival asking if I would mind changing hotels because the rooms are undergoing renovations... incredible!as if renovations and number of avaible rooms are not planned beforehand... obviously refused as the seminar as at this same hotel and there is no other hotel of good standards which is so central... jezus, really ,why would I book months ahead if I didn't mind staying at another place... curious what will happen tomorrow...I'll get back to Tripadvisor, positive or negative...

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Location”
Reviews.Author: crafted755
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel/ Paris break as a surprise for my birthday as it was our first time in Paris. Hotel is very central to all the main attractions - fantastic location! Got the tube from the airport and it stops right outside the hotel! Fantastic as we didn't have far to walk with our bags. We stayed in an executive room in the 6th floor and the room cost between 275/300 euros per night. Room was spacious and clean with free minibar. Only gripe with the room was the toilet was seperate to the bathroom which I thought was strange with regards to handwashing ect. We were told upon check in that breakfast was included so was slightly annoyed when we were charged 19 euros each per day for it! Luckily we got this refunded by reception after complaining. Also my husband tried to order a movie which didn't work either. Evenings are fab, lovely piano is played and the bar serve gorgeous cocktails and olives overall would stay here again and would reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine until you sleep”
Reviews.Author: PC65
Reviews.Content: 2 significant problems encountered with this hotel. They offered only 2 types of pillows, both of them of low quality. No alternatives given. I expressed my issue as I couldn't sleep with a synthetic pillow, but they replied that they couldn't do anything. For an hotel at this level, this was not acceptable. Secondly I almost missed my train (and paid 25 euros to gare du nord) because the driver took more than 20 minutes to arrive, and the reason was they couldn't find the hotel. As the hotel has obviously an agreement with a taxi company, the service was appalling. They didn't seem concerned or trying to resolve it with an alternative (ie call a taxi from the near rue de rivoli).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nachuml
Reviews.Content: Arrived with a colleague, about 11:00Pm. Check in was efficient and in few minutes we were on the lively pedestrian area, with lots of restaurants and bars. The service was very good. They were eager to help and they now how to. Breakfast was good, but I would expect more for 19 Euros. Variety was O.K. the same food on Friday and Saturday. I got the feeling that somebody just put many things out there, but didn't care too much if you enjoy it. - my feeling. My "Superior room" was large, with Tea and Coffee facilities. Also there is an ice machine in the corridor. WiFi was good in the room as well as in public areas. I use Voip and had good connection all the time. And again: Location. Everything is close. On the back of the hotel is the big shopping center Forum des Halles. Notre-dam, Louvre, Pompidou Center and more, are few minutes walking, The elevator to the big train and Metro station, Chatelet Les Halles, is 20 meters, so transportation is really easy. Many different kind of restaurants and Bars are within short walking distance. I will definitely consider staying at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good price”
Reviews.Author: RHB_Brazil
Reviews.Content: This Novotel is true to its brand purpose. It has a modern lobby and comfortable rooms, plus the location is right on top of the Les Halles metro station and walking distance to Notre Dame and some other great sightseeing places in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel surpassed my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: celestine B
Reviews.Content: stayed with husband and 2 year old son, had an executive queen room and was reasonably spacious with a small seating area which is a bonus especiallywith a young child, i'd recommend get a room with an opening window as the rooms get unbelievabley hot and stuffy due to the aircon, we were in a room with a window that opened so god knows how we'd have gotten on. room was very clean and modern, as is the lobby and bar, restaurant was nice and quite decently priced, staff are friendly and quite willing to help and quite a nice play area for children although slightly small. Area is perfect for tourists as very close to popular sites aswell as lots of clothes & shoe shops, restaurants and bars in the area with a good mix of choices. downsides would be the polyester bedding is quite cheap considering the price and is quite expensive for what it is (but as is the way in paris) but all in all a good comfortable hotel in an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Can't get more central with service and 4 star style than this?”
Reviews.Author: ctaurean72
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 months ago (sorry.. only just around to catching up on TA reviews).. for 2 nights with our 3 year old daughter. Never been to Paris before, so found the location of this Novotel fantastic as could easily walk to central shopping hubs, Louvre (amazing!!), La Seine and other classic tourist icons in Paris. Service in hotel was very good... loved the greeting on arrival with soft toy gift for the little one and hotel has good breakfast, pool etc. Room very clean and modern... fabulous stay overall. Thankyou.. can't wait to return...

Reviews.Title: “Yet more Americans in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kawaller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Paris loaded with travel and translation books with an ambitious schedule. Though we got a bit lost in the massive Forum Les Halles after exiting the RER we were very happy to find that our hotel was every thing we looked for. The lobby and bar lounge were spacious, clean, and comfortable. Check-in went smoothly and quickly and in English that was well spoken by staff that were glad to see us. And let me tell you that good employees are what can make or break a company. Phone calls and reservations were placed for us, flawless directions given, reputable taxis summoned, and a growing confidence that we were going to have the time of our lives. And we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great, easy location”
Reviews.Author: nolovelost28
Reviews.Content: Pros: Centrally located within walking distance of the Louvre and several other sites. Clean, modern look (felt like Vegas). Room was relatively spacious. Easy airport access (via RER B). Con: Our room's heating didn't work and they wouldn't move us. Instead they gave us the reception area's space heater, which worked out well enough for 2 nights, but I kind of felt bad for reception since it reached -8C and snowed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Large beautiful rooms, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: bevvy_babe
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were lucky enough to stay here for a week and loved every minute. This hotel is ideally located with a nice touch of luxury. All staff were truly lovely helpful people with great senses of humour, they went out of there way to cater to our needs. We will be staying there again. Thanks to all the staff especially Stephanie for a memorable stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolAnn057
Reviews.Content: Location is great for all the main sights.. walking distance to Notre Dame, Seine, Batobus, Louvre, Latin Quarter. Also very easy for getting to & from CDG airport or Eurostar by public transport. Châtelet is one of the main hubs and a stones throw from hotel so RER Ligne B, Métro and buses are all easily accessible. Facilities at the hotel were very good. Requested room with a view but advised that due to construction work in the area a room overlooking courtyard was better. We stayed in a superior suite on the 2nd floor and it was a good size, with a comfortable queen bed and a sofa; altogether quiet, clean, modern, accommodation. Bathroom was lovely with a powerful shower and very stylish sink. The separate toilet was a bonus !!! Only gripe was the wardrobe space .. it could have been a bit bigger... 6 coat hangers was not enough (it was a winter vacation so bulky jumpers and coats etc) but to be honest there was no room for any more in space provided!!! One hrs free internet allowed per day meant we could FB our photos/ check emails etc and there was no problem with speed/connection during our stay. Buffet breakfast was very good with a lot of choice (cold & hot buffet) plus specialised coffees available. All hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful...especially at the reception ... and this is not always the case in a chain hotel so felt it is worth mentioning. Plenty of shops and eating places in the area (must mention the yummy French desserts at Hippopotamus.. a chain restaurant... with reasonably priced, good choice of food...mainly for meat eaters). We felt safe at night as there are always lots of people around and the area is brightly lit. We usually stay on the Rive Gauche so this was a pleasant change and we would definitely book it again and recommend the hotel to others for location, convenience and good value for money. PS for the Brits reading this review we booked the hotel via the net with Thomas Cook as their price was the best available at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Close to most things”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, this is a chain hotel. as such it keeps up to a required standard. The reception staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel itself is within walking distance to Louvre, Latin Quarter, and Notre Dame (where several 'hop-on, hop-off buses start from). It is also directly above the RER line B (from CDG airport) which is a real bonus. The only drawback is that the Les Halles complex is being completely rebuilt (seems to have gone on for quite some time with no real sign of completion for another 12 months), so it is in the middle of a building site. That said, there is no noise from the construction works due to effective double glazing etc. Cannot coment on the breakfast as we took the much cheaper option of eating outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a large chain”
Reviews.Author: Eagleton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was of the typical standard you would expect from a large chain like Novotel. Clean, well organised, and well located. You cannot go wrong with it. The breakfast was also quite good. Just note one thing: There is quite a large construction going on next door to the hotel that causes some minimal noise disturbance. That is no criticism of the hotel as it is out of their control, but if you are planning to stay there you might be best to request a room on the other side to the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nitavant
Reviews.Content: Decided to choose this through tripadvisor. Great location, close to a lot of places to visit, including shooping and restaurant. Clean rooms. Only one negative: wifi inernet extremely slow

Reviews.Title: “great, central, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Little_Blondie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Novotel's and all of them have been good, but this one in Les Halles stood out from the others. It is very nicely furnished and decorated, really quite swish! There is a nice relaxing and calm ambience in the large bar/reception area which is great for unwinding with a drink at the end of a busy days sightseeing! The whole Hotel is very clean, modern and spacious. Our room was large, clean and very comfortable. We ate at the Hotel several evenings and enjoyed a very nice meal with wine that was reasonably priced. The breakfast was fantastic, everything you could wish for! The Chatelet-les-halles metro is just opposite the hotel and it is also within walking distance of some of the major attractions (Louvre, Conciergerie and Notre Dame all less than 1k). Overall, a very nice, 4 star, centrally located hotel. If we were to return to Paris we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: anana216
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Novotel couldn't have been better. The hotel is in a great location, in a vibrant neighborhood with several metro lines within walking distance. The hotel lobby and bar area was very nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They arranged for taxi pick-ups and even allowed us to check in early when we arrived 3 hours ahead of check-in. The continental breakfast was also great. I would highly recommend staying here if you'll be visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Well Located!”
Reviews.Author: nandamoreira
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, with a double bed and two single beds, helpfull staff! good breakfast, but not included. Metro just behind the hotel, just like a big shopping mall. Good location, near Rue de Rivoli and Louvre, in the 1°arr. I would definetely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great offer & location”
Reviews.Author: MohabElSawaf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my family (wife & 2 kids) in July 2009. It has excellent location with access to most of underground lines just below the hotel, bus station, seine river, Rivoli street of shopping, Latin quarter with many restaurants, also grocery & fruits shop. Diret RAR to EuroDisney. Amazing breakfast collection & variety. Clean room. Big sofa bed for two children. I had an offer with 65Euro per night without breakfast & I added the breakfast. The shower bath is separated compartment from the toilette.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but some down sides”
Reviews.Author: KateLondon_9
Reviews.Content: I did have a good stay in the Novotel Les Halles. I wish there was a category between average and very good - because my stay here was neither very good or average. It was good. I have stayed in this hotel before and came back because of the location and the breakfast. The location is very good - close to Notre Dame, Latin Quarter and the Louvre. The breakfast was also first rate when I came the first time. This visit wasn't quite as good as my first - the rooms are sterile and very plain, but that's ok as they're very clean. However, this time the room we were given was so stuffy - there was no air. The window overlooked the restaurant so you couldn't open it to get any air in it. Neither did the air conditioning seem to work and the room was constantly boiling hot. And the pillows were very lumpy and uncomfortable. Then the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night and we got dressed and left the room but was then told to go back to our rooms without an explanation or apology by someone in jeans, who I assumed worked in the hotel. I got food poisoning and the staff very kindly let us stay in our room until 3pm before checking out, instead of the usual 12pm. However, we had paid extra for breakfast which we never had because I was sick. So, a bit of a mixed review overall.

Reviews.Title: “good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Convenient location with easy Metro access. The hotel employees were always very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and a good size. I had a balcony that opened up the square where the enterence of the hotel was. There is also many restaurants next to it located in the pedestrian zone. No ironing facilities, broken ice machine, no face washer. I expect a better breakfast for 19 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but construction site just next to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelerToUAE
Reviews.Content: everithing is fine exept the reconstraction of "Les Halles" just next to the hotel. Workers start about 7 in the morning with a lot of noice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice loctated Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Main advantage of this hotel is the location in the middle of Paris. Some of the most interesting sites can be reached by feet or short Metro - travel. Good condition of hotelrooms. Unfortunately loud room - neighbours, but no noise from outside. Very tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: toutou_bubibub
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel many times and appreciate the consitent level of quality. And this is what we also got at this Novotel. Check-in was professional and friendly. The rooms are spacious and were still in a good condition. Do ask for rooms facing the front since the view is quite nice overlooking the front courtyard. We did not have breakfast since Paris has better options for that but the breakfast spread looked pretty ok. Location wise, the hotel is very centrally located in walking distance to the Louvre. Metro station is just in front of the hotel which is perfect. The only downside in this hotel was the front staff. We asked for restaurant recommendation and the staff was not really familiar with the local area and could not really recommend something other then from the restaurant guide he took out which had sponsored restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location, pity that our room felt like a cell as the window looked down inside the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: monicabird
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights here. Excellent location, good service, clean rooms but we were given a 2nd floor room that looked down on the restaurant, no natural light, only a neon light. Poor ventilation made it a very stuffy room. Very noisy on New Year's Eve till 2am.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Dropping?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September 2011 and were hugely impressed by the services offered - e.g. a concierge desk which could organise all kinds of tours, visits, etc. and give all kinds of advice but that has sadly disappeared and you now have to stand in line at the hotel reception, which is sometimes VERY busy with check-ins and check outs, to try and get information on sights, museums, etc. Also, there was a hotel employee at the door of the hotel who organised taxis for residents - he too has disappeared. The hotel location remains superb but some areas of the hotel are looking a little less glossy ... We would currently rate it as a good 3 star rather than 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: maryloujoe
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean and near all walking areas near Notre Dame and the Louvre. Took advice of others and did NOT eat breakfast at hotel. Headed to Notre Dame on first full day and ate near there in the Latin Quarter=cheap and many places to eat inside for under 10 euros per person including beverage and dessert. Did eat on Sunday nite in bar area, omlette with side was generous and filling. Internet in lobby free, otherwise 12 euros for access in room. We found lobby areas to be multiple and comfortable. Storage for luggage to allow more travel on day of discharge. Good option for families and others. Safe area. The room had full size bed plus sleeper sofa folded out to make 2 separate beds. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: AlbusD
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December for a week with family for a vacation. Check-in was without fuss into a family room which was decent. Only complaint is the small size of the bathroom. Beyond that, everything else had been excellent especially with the conceirge of the hotel who was extremely helpful in occassions when i needed some help like navigating the area around Les Halles, recommendating great restaurants and arranging for airport transfer. The hotel is in a very convenient area with plenty of restaurants, next to the Les Halles Forum shopping complex and most importantly right above the Chatelet Les Halles underground station which i understand to be the largest in the world. This was most convenient for me when coming from London with Eurostar, visiting Versailles, Disneyland Paris and the major attractions in Paris . My initial apprehension with the construction around the area was unfounded since although there is some noise, we did not experience any inconvenience. Will certainly stay in this hotel again due to its convenience and excellent service from the staff especially the conceirge!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mbett1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to Junior suite as am A Club platinum. Lovely room with excellent bathroom. Hotel is in excellent location, staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming - not always the case in France! Did not use restaurant as many good places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: andandgaenor
Reviews.Content: we really had a lovely weekend stay and all the area of the hotel where clean and tidy.staff polite..only down side .it was quite expensive to drink and dine

Reviews.Title: “Simple but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Joanna B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Novotel was the first (in November) and last (in December) stop during our honeymoon. The bed was very hard on the first stay, but fine the second time around, so perhaps it depends on the room you are in. The room itself was small-ish, but had all the necessary things for a short stay. The bathroom was pretty good, however in both rooms there was mould above eye level in the shower and a strong smell of chlorine. The staff were friendly and helpful, with suggestions on how to get to places, where to eat and so forth. We were unfortunately quite sick on the second stay, and staff assisted us by allowing a late check out as our flight wasn't until 11 pm, so this helped us immensely. Breakfast was good, and had a good range of options. Worth noting is that the temperature control is ONLY a heater - how many degrees you would like it set above the current room temperature. Until we spoke to reception, thinking the thermostat was broken, we thought it was an airconditioner that both heated and cooled. As such, we had the window open for the first couple of days to let it cool down again! We would most likely stay there again if we were to go back to Paris any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: sleepycucumbers
Reviews.Content: We were happy to stay here - hotel room was clean, and the executive room was spacious enough for three people and three large suitcases. The sofa bed actually had two single beds that folded out individually, giving us even more space to open our suitcases. The bathroom entrance was extremely close to the bed. Our bathroom came with an average hair dryer, bathtub, sink, and standing shower. The toilet was in a separate area from the bathroom and didn't have a sink, so that was a little strange, but it didn't matter. We arrived super-early and took the train to the Les Halles stop. When you get off, you want to make sure you check out the map in the train station, so that you come out the right exit (the Berger St. exit), cuz if you do, the hotel is literally right there. But it was very nice of the hotel to let us check in right away (at like 7:30am in the morning) - we couldn't have been more grateful. We used the train to travel to the places farther away, like the Eiffel Tower or to go from one end of Paris to the other side. The trains were quite convenient, but be prepared for how crazily crowded they can be (this was on the weekends). We actually had to push and be pushed to fit us all in - I literally could not move my arms once we were on! We were happy that the hotel had community computers and a printer, and we were able to print up advance tickets, but make sure you procure your advance tickets a couple of days before because if you wait until the day before thinking that you're going to get tickets to the Eiffel Tower for the early slot, they are all sold out. We didn't eat there, as there are plenty of good places within walking distance. This place is definitely worth the money, especially if you do the advance rate.

Reviews.Title: “happy to reccommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandwDurham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in late November this year (2011). This is the second time we have used this hotel, so obviously you know we are already happy with it This time, unexpectedly, we had some mobility problems, but there are so many bars and bistros and restaurants near by, some in pedestrian areas, that we had no problems and really enjoyed the experience. The room was great... slept too late cos the bed was so comfortasble. There is entertainment in the bar in the evening and I can definately recommend it. We saw two different entertainers. .Both really good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for walking in Paris”
Reviews.Author: igormorbeck
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for a meeting and then three days for leisure. Me and my wife had great time, visiting many attractions by walk. Very cleaning hotel, central location and with nice design. The room was clean and silent.

Reviews.Title: “VERY central and great for families!”
Reviews.Author: divachitown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of November '11 with two adults and two children. Nice bar and restaurant area. Kids area with xbox. The rooms were smallish but it still slept four just fine. I wish they had mini humidifiers in the room because it was very dry but other then that everything was great. The location is absolutely perfect and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: c_sheree68
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris with my daughter (21) and son (14) from August 17-21. The original plan was to stay in an apartment which once we got there was a sad disappointment. Being familiar with the Les Halles area from a trip the year prior, I went to Novotel for a rescue. I chose Novotel because though I did not stay there the year before, I was impressed with the facility and vowed that I would one day stay there.The Novotel staff was very friendly and accommodating and helped us with our transition; we were also able to communication effectively with the staff. The hotel is conveniently located near the Chatelet Les Halles station and provided close access to many attractions as well as the underground Les Halles mall. There is also immediate access to the bike rentals right outside the front entrance. Our room was spacious, had air conditioning, was clean, well maintained, had a good view, was right next to the ice machine and more importantly we felt safe. There was cable television and internet access which was greatly appreciated. It provided a perfect place to relax after a day filled with walking an exploring. My children had no problem exploring on their own and walking around the plaza at the Fountain of the Innocents and the surrounding area without concern. The grounds are well maintained and the lobby and patio area are beautiful. The price was higher than I would have preferred, though not outrageous; but after the apartment fiasco I learned you get what you pay for. Luckily I was able to get my money refunded from the apartment. Upon our departure the staff also helped us secure a taxi to CDG (didn't want to do the RER again). I am very happy with our decision to stay at Novotel and will do so again on our next visit. My children found the trip to be very rewarding and have vigorously resumed their French studies. I want to thank the Novotel staff for being so nice to us and thank you so much for saving our trip. I most highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great lobby and bar, ok room”
Reviews.Author: shoes4me
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Paris was in a fantastic location. The Chatelat metro was right outside the door, close to the Louvre, minutes to walk to the Seine river. It is very centralled located, we walked the the Arc de Triomphe, along Champs Elysees, Louvre, beautiful parks the Effel Tower, then you can go in the order direction towards the other districts, the Latin Quarter, Moulin Rouge, Marais. The location was perfect and I would stay at this hotel again. The bar and lobby were contemporary, nice place to have a coffee or drinks. The room was alright. The bed seemed new, but the bathroom and other areas seemed to need some updating. But we didn't spend much time in the room anyway, so the location made up for it. Breakfast was great, offering hot foods and lattes, but when we checked in they told us what time breakfast started so we assumed it was included. That was our fault for not double checking so was charged 70 Euros for 2 breakfasts which I thought was really steep when I could have just picked up a fresh Croissant for 1.60 Euro. The great thing was there was a queen sized bed which is rare in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff, pleasant bedrooms and public areas. Location convenient for Metro and within walking distance of major galleries. Breakfast very good with excellent scrambled eggs and wide choice of options. Dinner in the restaurant generally quite good but desserts disappointing. Only major criticism was finding ham in a vegetarian omlette. The staff were very apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly front desk, snafu with the breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: SunInHawaii
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed our stay here, the breakfast buffet was great. However when we checked out it seems there had been a miscommunication about the breakfast buffet - they wanted to charge us for it, after we'd been told when we checked in that it was included. After some back and forth, they ended up not charging us. I would not have been a happy camper if we'd had to pay for it. We could definitely have used a bit more storage for our family of four. There's no drawers at all, and few shelves. The front desk was very friendly, the location is very central and in the midst of a very busy area, that's hopping in the evenings, lots of people watching to do.

Reviews.Title: “The 18th Birthday Lou Boutin Tour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We needed a central location as we were in Paris for just one night as a birthday treat to pick up a certain pair of shoes. Hotel perfectly located for all sites and Metro. Unfortunately room was not up to usual high Novotel standard expected.....safe was broken, toilet seat not fixed and shower door didn't close leading to flooded and slippy floor. Breakfast and bar was great though staff were distracted and stretched by large party of demanding Canadians.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for strolling around in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 4 and half days at the beginning of November the hotel had an excellent position in the center of the city. Walking distance to Notre Dame, Le Louvre, Les Marais, Avenue Haussmann. We even walked up to Champs Elyssés. Metro and RER is situated just beside with easy access to Versailles and the GDG Airport. Lots of restaurants in the nearby quarters. I will definitely come back the next time I go to Paris Swedihs family with teenage daughter

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: rusty49
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean, but not too fancy, Hotel located close to all attractions. My wife and I love to explore by walking and this location is very close to The Louvre, Isle Notre Dame and all other sites. The walk up The Champs Elysee to The Arc De Triumph was a hike but worth it. The Hotel is also close to many restaurants and Bistros which are again within easy walking distance. Generally a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “From Sweden to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Two adults and one 17 years old girl. Too little space in the room for tree persons. No wardrobe for all our clothes. The rest was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, stylish lobby”
Reviews.Author: wsrb
Reviews.Content: For a long weekend Paris we chose (2 parents and 2 children) for this hotel. The room on the 6th floor was fine and sufficiently roomy (separate beds for the children). Tip voor Novotel: please change the blankets for quilts. Much more hygienic and in line with the room articles Novotel tries to sell to customers. The location is excellent, right between Quartier Latin, Centre Pompidou and Louvre. Busses and metro right outside the hotel, as well as the Paris community rent bikes. Breakfast was and the lobby roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Strike”
Reviews.Author: AndreyVG12009 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When I was there, there was a strike of cleaning personal, it was awful. And I don't like insulation in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Do not let them book your transfers!!!”
Reviews.Author: kat243
Reviews.Content: With two kids and lots of luggage we had arranged a transfer from CDG to the hotel upon arrival - it never showed up leaving us at the airport wondering what to do. Not a good start. When we were leaving we got reception to arrange a taxi transfer to CDG which AGAIN never showed up and they didn't actually seem to care. Apart from this the rooms were typical European small but very clean and a fantastic location. Being right opposite Chatelet Les Halles metro/RER was fantastic and we were within walking distance of Notre Dame, Latin Quarter and Louvre. Never tried the breakfast despite what they tried to tell us upon check out because the boulangeries nearby are all fantastic and very cheap. We were feeding a family of four every morning on pastries for about 10EURO. Cannot rate the dinner restaurant either as we never used it - why go to Paris to then eat in a hotel???

Reviews.Title: “Protests Finally ended”
Reviews.Author: TripReviewer88
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs major refurbishing. The towels were old, the baseboard was missing, the tissue holder kept falling off. For some reason, the room was always hot, even though it was cool out and the window was open. We messed with the air conditioning, but our room never really cooled down. Also, the shower never got warm enough for me. The protests were annoying. They were in the lobby the first five days we were there and they finally ended today before we left. It was especially hard for us when we would head back to the hotel so our baby could nap and the banging drums would wake him up and keep him awake for hours. To add to this, we had a "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door and after finally getting our son to take his nap, housekeeping called our room to see if we wanted it cleaned and our son woke up. On the good, we didn't have any problems with the staff. Sam was especially nice. It is close to public transport and walking distance to many sites. I don't think I will stay at this hotel again. Although the location was convenient, I didn't really care for the area and I do not like how Accor hotels seem to nickel and dime every service they have (ie. no free wi-fi or breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “shame about the protests and building work and so on......”
Reviews.Author: Kay K
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights from 26 October (2 adults/2 children) from London. Although a great location, we always had to search how to find the hotel and never managed to work out how to exit at the right metro exit. Upon arrival we were met by protesters (cleaning staff). We thought it was a local festival! But soon realised that cut up newspaper in the lobby and banging on drums and whistling, posters and shouting meant something was up. You couldn't hear yourself think. We were quickly taken to the first floor make shift check in and shown to our room before we could change our minds. Our room was 'ok' but didn't meet the standards of reception area etc. Room size and beds for kids was better than expected, but if you stay in room 420 beware of wet carpet from the shower outside the bathroom. Also, we would have thought they might have managed our view away from the building site which covered a massive area. But the hotel was very busy. Waking up to the building noise and protesters was awful. Didn't like the breakfast atmosphere at all - too many queues and people and there was a separate 'family area' (where we were sat on the first morning) with a balloon man who looked liked he'd just fallen out of a stephen king movie and very large screens showing cartoons, you just don't need first thing in the morning. We opted for the 'grown up area' on the last morning - much better and good value. The restaurant didn't have a great choice in the evening (and very costly) and shame the bar didn't have a separate snack menu. I don't think we'd stay here again - it was all very impersonal although the staff did their very best in the circumstances and nothing was too much trouble. If you are there with the protests going on ask for a discount - we got 50% off our first nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but not the greatest 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Hank
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel les Halles on a recent 3 day pleasure trip to Paris. The hotel is very well located next to Chatalet les Halles metro/RER making it handy if travelling Via CDG airport. It's also a stones throw from pont neuf and the bateaux's and Notre Dame. I think we were just unfortunate but the cleaning staff were protesting outside the hotel as we arrived. Regardless we fought our way through and luckily our room was ready early. During our stay the front of house staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English and even put up with my poor pigeon French. The communal areas of the hotel definitely feel 4 star but the rooms do not. Our room was very bland had a really poor bed, loose fixtures and fittings and one of the towels was dirty on arrival. Unfortuanately the protesting cleaners ramped it up a gear on the third day of our stay and made it into the hotel lobby. Getting woken up at 8:30 in the morning by the constant banging on drums, shouting etc. was not great. What was even worse was having one of them feel it was ok to shout in our faces with a megaphone as we went through the lobby. I feel the security should have been tighter. There was certainly a lot of security around just they didn't seem to be doing a lot. To the cleaners, I lost all sympathy for you when you made it into the lobby and your completely unacceptable behaviour. All in all it didn't spoil our stay massively and I hope the protests were a rare event. It's not the best 4 star hotel we've stayed in but maybe par for the course in central Paris?

Reviews.Title: “Labor protest in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: Moss9924
Reviews.Content: The lobby is filled with confetti and loud drumming staff on strike. No apologies or compensation from the hotel. Long line for breakfast table.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheBingles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Location was perfect as directly outside there was a Metro stop. Although we never used it. The hotel is within walking distance to Notre Dame and the Louvre. We travelled with 2 children and walking distances were not an issue. The room was a good size, comfy bed and very clean. We had the full buffet breakie and it was great. 36 Euro per adult and our kids ate free. The selection was perfect. Cereals, breads, eggs, bacon ,mushrooms,sausages,potatoes,cheeses,pastries,juices etc etc.. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ludo_swinnen
Reviews.Content: I go to this hotel every time I am in Paris. It is a good hotel in a busy city. You can get there from CDG Airport by RER train and the exit is 100 meters from the entrance of the hotel. The rooms are typical Novotel rooms, so correct, clean and with some extras like a coffee machine. The personal is ´Paris style´ friendly, arrogance mixed with good service. Be in time for the breakfast as it has often longer waiting times. You can easily get from the hotel to any place in Paris by Metro or just on foot. In short, a good place to sleep, eat and rest in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Les Hell”
Reviews.Author: jjg004
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this for our last night in Europe before heading home to Australia after a month traveling. We were hoping for a nice relaxing evening and an early night but it was thwarted by the hotel cleaning staff protesting. The protesting cleaners (at least a dozen of them) spent their time chanting, playing a vuvuzela (think the loud annoying instrument played during the Sth African soccer World Cup), djembe drums and ripping up tissues and throwing them all over the place. It would have been OK if the cleaners stayed in one area of the hotel, but they were allowed to parade all over the hotel, through the lobby and up onto the room floors. We went down the bar to try and escape them when they came around level 1, but then they came back down the the lobby/bar, so we went back upstairs to the room, then they were back again! It was just horrendous. All we wanted to do was crawl into bed, watch a movie and get an early night before our flights home. The room: basic but adequate, bed was comfy. Our superior room was on level 1 (room 146), was right next to the lifts and overlooked the plaza out front of hotel - suffice to say the room was quite noisy despite double glazing. Also our toilet room smelt like urine, I'm not sure if this had something to do with the striking cleaners, but it definitely was not cleaned properly. Obviously industrial action doesn't happen everyday and we realise in this instance we have been unlucky. Unfortunately though I can't rate the hotel in a favourable light because of our horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay with family in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: tuzhara
Reviews.Content: To start with, I will tell you that it's not an easy thing to find a really good family hotel in Europe, and France is not an exception. However, Novotel chain (belonging to Accor) has a few of their family hotels in Paris, and this one is the most centrally located, and it's really good in terms of value for money, especially when you book early. We travelled two families with 4 children. We got to the hotel in the noon, but our rooms were not ready so we left our luggage in the storage room and went on a promenade to have a look around and a lunch, too. When we were back at around 03.00 PM, the rooms were ready, as promised. Also, the staff were very helpful and attentive -- they gave us four or five umbrellas upon request, as it was raining; every time asked they provided detailed instructions about getting around the city, as this was our first time in Paris; and explained in good detail everything we asked about their cuisine during dinner, as we had our lunches out in the city. We had our breakfasts at the hotel -- buffet with good selection, free for 2 children under 16 staying with their parents. It's a very nice touch to serve breakfasts for families in a separate room with two enormous TV screens and a clown making balloon swords and animals for children as well as a magician showing hocus-pocuses. Above of that, children got wooden yoyos and some other small stuff like color pencils etc. As to two X-Boxes in the lobby next to the restrooms and another one next to the dining room we had our breakfasts at, it's common for all Novotel hotels, at least for those we stayed at during our two-week trip across France and Italy, and is a nice touch, too. A plus is that the hotel is located right next to a big Parisian subway hub with many metro lines and RER (railway to various destinations including Disneyland) and it's a very convenient way to get almost everywhere in Paris. The hotel is also close to the Louvre (10 mins walk).

Reviews.Title: “Great location for wandering to the Marais, Notre Dame, Le Louvre etc”
Reviews.Author: joelsw18
Reviews.Content: We often go to Paris and have stayed in a few different hotels, but the past few visits we have booked the Novotel Les Halles as our first choice. Its just like every other Novotel in France in terms of rooms, nice and clean, not luxury but comfortable and welcoming. Little touches like the espresso machine in the rooms make a difference. The thing is, you always know exactly what you are getting with a Novotel and the prices are not cheap but they are in line with other hotels in the area which are much more hit and miss. The location is great because you can walk to plenty of Parisien attractions in a few minutes. The Pompidou centre is just 2 mins away. The bars, cafes, shops and restaurants of the Marais are another five to ten minutes beyond there. You can easily walk in other directions to Le Louvre, to the Ile de la Cite (for Notre Dame), and so on. You can even walk across the park and go the Sunday morning street market just 5 mins away, where you'll be able to mingle with real Parisiens buying their fresh bread, veg, meat, fish, flowers, etc, or have a coffee in a cafe and watch them all as they go past. The main downsides of the hotel are that breakfast can be a nightmare if the hotel is busy. Plus there is work going on in Les Halles to totally renovate the area so if you have a view from your window it might include a building site (not a messy one, but not exactly the romantic Paris view you imagined!) We've always the found the staff to be helpful, but you have to ask, their not exactly forthcoming with the help if you sit quietly at breakfast or don't ask at check in. We have been upgraded to a Junior Suite in the past and loved the room but havent booked one since. You;re in Paris for god's sake, so who wants to sit in a slightly larger room with nicer features, when you could be outside a cafe, sipping a glass of wine and watching teh world go by? Save yiour money and go for the superior room if you want a nice room, that's got enough space for two and a nice bed. The bathrooms in Novotel are somewhat eclectic, you'll either love them or hate them, but they are the same design in each Novotel room we've stayed in in France. Funny moulded pastic sinks and shower doors that open into the middle of the bathroom (thus dripping water all over the slippery floor tiles every time you use the shower). But we've learned to cope with those things as the location is great, the beds are very good for the price range and the hotel is easy, relaxed and yet still on the right side of sophisticated. What prompted me to write this review is that I've just booked my next stay at this hotel, for my birthday in December, because I looked on various websites (booking.com, Tripadvisor, etc) and this is still the best hotel for the price range back to which I can walk (or rather, stagger) after a night out in the Marais

Reviews.Title: “The website said it is the most central hotel in Paris - and it is!”
Reviews.Author: Tavare
Reviews.Content: The Novotel's website claimed it was paris' most centrally located hotel, and after three nights staying with our two children, you had to agree. We were able to walk to the Louvre, to the Marais, to Notre Dame...and the Chatelet-Les Halles metro station gave us easy access to just about every where we wanted to go in Paris. The hotel is surrounded by hundreds of restaurants, with Hippopotamus being the best choice for kids (they also do some very good meat dishes). The four of us shared a room which came with a queen bed and two convertible single sofas, so it was more than adequate, especially as the children ate free as part of the Novotel package. Unfortunately the Les Halles area is under serious renovation so the usually wide-open spaces were blocked off, but as we spent much of the time at places like the Louvre, Eiffel Tower and Montmartre it wasn't much of an issue. Service was very friendly, and they even politely put up with my bad French. Paris isn't all that child friendly, so finding the right hotel is very important. The Novotel provided a very nice oasis at the end of our hectic days. They had a well-organised children's play room which had a couple of XBox players, while the Mac computers provided free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, ver good.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Generally we felt the room , location and standard of hotel was very good. Sleep quality was only average due to the early hours construction noise of the Les Halles Forum outside our room. We acknowledge this was not the fault of the hotel though and simply one of those things. However, the breakfast offer was misleading and not explained to us at the start of our stay. As a result, we thought it was included in the room price (as it had been in London), so when we were charged over 200 Euros at the end of stay for breakfast, which we didn't fully take advantage of, we were less than impressed and quite annoyed. We would be willing to stay again with an Accor hotel, but would make sure we clarify all the associated costs from the outset so there are no unexpected and not budgeted for surprises at the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “room w/o ironing board.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is clean, very close to amenities,we found out that some novotel, hotel their is ironing board which normaly when we travel we use some ironing when needed.the services are good.counter staff are very helpfull. like in London the room their is an ironing board which is great we like it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable well located”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveGoodFoodToo
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a higher floor and noticed little road noise. Construction of a large are adjacent to the hotel is currently underway but I did not notice any significant noise. My little boy actually enjoyed watching all the construction equipment. Breakfast was very good and overall a good value by Paris standards with a large selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Paris trip”
Reviews.Author: Carlotta M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for six nights. We had requested early arrival and to my great surprise the room was ready when we got there at 11 a.m. The rooms are small by American standards, but perfectly acceptable. The rooms are clean and air-conditioned. Amandine at registration helped with great tips on restaurants in the area. There is construction going on outside the hotel, but noise was not a factor. The location is super. A metro station is right outside the hotel, and we were within walking distance to Notre Dame and the Louvre. Paris is a real walking around city, so wear comfortable shoes. The only drawback at the hotel was the cost of the buffet breakfast. There are few options for those that like a large breakfast. If a petit dejeunier is your preference, your in luck there is a restaurant around the corner. The bed in our room was very comfortable, but it was queen size. If you are a big person, I would inquire about a king-size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Les Halles ... Great place to stay for families!”
Reviews.Author: Emily K
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely two room suite which fit our needs perfectly. The staff was courteous and helpful, and it was a great location from which to see Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: guimas17
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great value. Great location near a subway station and walking distance from Louvre, Pompidou, pont Neuf and pont des arts. There's really a big construction going on now at Les Halles, men at work, blocked streets, but the hotel's got fine sound blocking. Couldn't hear anything inside the building. We bought water, wine, bread and cheese at the next door market and had our own breakfast in the room. Coffee, minibar and safety box available. I found the neighborhood OK, no problem walking around at 2:00am. It's not as charming as the Marais or the Quartier Latin, but these places are not too far. Free wi-fi internet available in the room through a daily renewable subscription.

Reviews.Title: “All within five minute walk to the lourve.”
Reviews.Author: mkbk1234
Reviews.Content: Vacation with 2 adults, 13 and 10 yr old girls. The location of the hotel is very easy walking distance to lourve, Norte dame and siene river. Third trip to Paris and this is the best location we have ever stayed at. Restaurants are plenty with a huge variety and right at the front door. The room - he have a queen bedded suite which has a sofa bed in a separate room with a dining room table. For Paris standards, this is really quite large. Very comfortable for all us,considering we had four large bags. The rooms are new with separate shower and toilet. Bathroom has shower and separate bath with well equipped hair dryer. Kettle is included with the options of an espresso machine. Two tv's and a balcony with doors that open up. Though you cannot sit on the balcony. Breakfast is 18 euros for adults with children eating free. Dinner offers the same value. If you really need a great location to stay would highly recommend this hotel. Ps the bed is quite hard though, just a little side issue but aren't they all in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, in a messy area”
Reviews.Author: Marcos040
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 days at Novotel Les Halles, the best thing about it are the location close to the subway and the room, quite OK, clean, but small. With one kid it´s ok, with two it´s tight. The negative point is the neighborhood, with lots of refurbishments around the hotel block, streets closes, men at work, etc. And the Les Halles area is not the best side of Paris. Except by the Pompidou Center, there is only local commerce, not very interesting. The breakfast is charged at around 18 euros per person, I did not try it. Very close there is a nice local bistro for a salad of sandwich, right in front of the Hotel main door.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent localization”
Reviews.Author: pelicanoPortugal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated in the heart of Paris, good for day tourism and for the nightlife. It's near everything. The public transports (metro/RER) are just at the doorstep and can take you everywhere. Nice lobby, friendly staff (except for the bar meal service that was very slow) and a regular breakfast, although served in a small room. Our room was situated in the top floor and was big enough for the three of us. The bed and the sofa-bed were very comfortable. Was very easy for us to make the Navigo card in the Les Halles metro station. There were many food options near, ranging from fast food to two very good restaurants (Grizzli and Lamfe) You can also find nearby supermarkets and Boulangerie-Patisseries with delicious deserts. The price is a bit steep but it's worth it. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: nycp76
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately stayed there one night, but I wish I could have stayed longer. Location was amazing, the hotel is spotless, I had an amazing room, on the top floor , I would say that it was a suite, very spacious , seating area, love the bathroom, great shower. The front desk staff was professional! Love the internet station in the lobby very useful, it was great because u could also print. Had breakfast the next morning in the dining room, and you could find anything you wanted on the buffet!! Also I appreciated to see the General Manager i think is name was Julien Donzel in the lobby area and breakfast room, to make sure that my stay was enjoyable as well as greeting other clients. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “good location; better Novotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GalwayGeographer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my older son on a bonding trip - and selected the hotel purely for its unbeatable location. As Novotels go, this one is below average - in Paris, I much preferred the one at the Gare de Lyon or in Bercy, both of which are cleaner, offer more space and better value and have more recently been updated - but Les Halles does have the great advantage of offering a direct RER line to Charles-de-Gaulle airport. Until 2013 travels may want to note that the adjacent 'Les Halles' area just to the North of the hotel is undergoing massive renovations which translates into considerably reduced access to the shopping area and some noise during daytime.

Reviews.Title: “An impersonal high traffic hotel hanging by it's nails on the four stars”
Reviews.Author: UniversalTracker
Reviews.Content: Busy, impersonal hotel in "Novotel" non-descript style without any "ambiance" whatsoever. Communal areas of decent quality, but rooms very simple with tiny, unventilated bathrooms. The bright spot was a late check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel, nice room and friendly service - good value”
Reviews.Author: Cherog
Reviews.Content: If you know Paris, then you know you can be lucky to get a room which provides enough space to walk around your bed nevertheless of the size of your suitcases. Novotel is one of these few hotels. I had a nice room on the top floor, got free high speed internet access. I could open my window over looking the backyard and enjoying the quiet nights. Bathroom is fine, convenient shower, a large king size bed, small desk and some cupboards. In the morning I enjoyed my tea from the tea kettle and afterwards a nice Nespresso all included in the price. I preferred to get my breakfast around the corner. After 09.00h you find a lot of small Cafés where you can your espresso and French croissant for a fair price. The hotel itself is close to the Halles, le centre Pompidou and you find a great deal of other sightseeing points of Paris in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Paris city and hotels great!”
Reviews.Author: travelloverszamswiss
Reviews.Content: This hotel as always for Novotel chains is well worth it. I was really clean and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location, right in the heart of Paris..."”
Reviews.Author: Teerex51
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is hard to beat for a Paris weekend. You can walk to the Louvre, the Hotel de Ville, Notre Dame and Boulevard St. Germain, while the Les Halles complex is just out the door. We toured Paris by Batobus (the hop on-hop off boat service) and staggered back to our room at the end of our 12-hour day. The room was not very large by any stretch of the imagination but was very comfortable. There's a Starbucks at Level -3 of the Forum Des Halles and that's where we headed to every morning for breakfast, not being overly fond of hotel food in general.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel for family weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola H
Reviews.Content: We booked the Novotel les Halles primarily because we were coming into Paris from Beauvais on the shuttle bus to Porte Maillot then on the metro to les Halles. It was a great choice! The hotel itself is modern, extremely clean, spacious sound-proofed rooms and has a great bar area. The staff were absolutely fantastic, friendly and helpful. An added bonus was the left luggage room which meant that we could check out (midday) and leave our bags all day until it was time for us to head back to the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in central Paris. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ruthi2
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for site seeing. Rer train, metro on doorstep. Breakfast not included in price & at 18 Euros each was expensive for 4. Plenty of places nearby for breakfast (4 for the price of 1 in hotel!!). Would highly recommend buying Paris Pass, includes rer, metro bus tickets and most attractions. Walked straight into Louvre when the queue must have been at least 3 hrs long. Saves an enormous amount of time & fiddling with money!!

Reviews.Title: “THE LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: DominicBathEngland
Reviews.Content: The great virtue of this bustling hotel is that it is in a pedestrianised zone a moment from the Pompidou Centre and with a massive metro interchange beneath ( and also a garage for guests,so rare in Paris ). Our room was immaculate and had a great view of Montmartre. Bathrooms are not big but are decent. No noise penetrated the room. The young man in charge of helping with luggage was a very pleasant whirlwind . I do not rate Novotel breakfasts and would not recommend you pay 18 euros for one. Go out .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hoorayfarray
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when visiting Paris for work. The location was very convenient for vote my business and the few hours I had for seeing the city. The room was modern, clean, and comfortable. The staff helpful and friendly. They even stored my baggage in a secure room while I was out for the day. They assisted with car service to the airport as well. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: Brienemiene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel hotel for a short weekend in september 2010. Because we were in Paris only for the weekend, we searched for a hotel in the absolute centre of the City of Lights. And did we stay in the centre or what! Situated at Les Halles, a enormous shopping centre and dito subway station, the Novotel hotel is perfect to explore Paris by metro or more preferably, by foot. The rooms of the hotel were very large for Paris. The only thing that was a bit dissapointing was the the fact that we received a smoking room, although we're both non-smoking. But otherwise, the bed was very big, as was the bathroom. And you won't be disappointed by the breakfast you get. You have a illimited choice of bread, croissant, fresh fruit, cereals etc. So, if you want to stay in the absolute centre of Paris, you can pick this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location. You pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: HiJackItaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights as a starting point for a trip to Normandy. The hotel is conveniently locateld at the very heart of Paris. You have at walking distance: Notre-Dame, Musse du Louvre, Opera, Place de la Concorde and many more. The hotel is a regular 3 star Novotel. It's clean and room's space is average for standard rooms (Executive rooms are better but they come with a significant extra price). We found it special for kids because it provides some specific "features" such as two PS2 stations, a kid's corner, an XBOX360 with kinect games and a special brekfast for kids in the summertime (With clowns, shaped baloons and small gifts). Hotel restaurant is average and buffet is not worth the price and there are many places you can dine better and/or cheaper. I don't have any particular complaint about the hotel, but it's definitely pricey for the overall look and service, anyway position and private parking (Can accomodate a big van like ours) are defintely a plus we have been happy to pay for. Please be advised that "Les halles" square is going through an heavy renovation and you could hear noise in some rooms and have some difficulties reaching the hotel by car and walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: smc4q
Reviews.Content: We returned today from Paris and stayed in the Novotel Paris Les Halles. We had room 220....fabulous!! Double bed and 2 bed settees, plenty of space, perfect for us and our kids (4 & 6). The staff are so pleasant and couldn't be more helpful. Kids are so welcome and are given a toy on arrival and at breakfast a guy was blowing up balloons and joking with the kids......great! There is also a small kids area with playstation. Our room over looked the construction work and can say never bothered us at all, the noise never woke us and the view was still fab! Could hear bit of noise if you opened the windows during the day, but who's in during the day in Paris? There area behind the hotel isn't the best, we never felt unsafe though and always headed to the river when leaving. The location is so close to the river, the Louvre and Notradame and right next to the RER train station. We had breakfast which was buffet style ;o) and had dinner one evening (summer buffet), also very good. Will definately be back to this hotel when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Touristy_11
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast to kick start your day, they have everything that a family will need. Great variety and quantity which was great for both adults and children. The hotels location was ideal, helpful staff and nice clean modern rooms. Would recommend it. We walked to the Louvre and Notre Dame with easy access also to transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and top location”
Reviews.Author: HaurakiNorthShore
Reviews.Content: excellent modern hotel in prime location. We did a lot of research on Internet looking for a single room to accommodate two adults and two teenagers. Novotel gave us room with double and two single beds. When booking we tried Novotel website and three general hotel sites. All had slightly different rules on the ages of kids that were allowed for same room at Novotel. Wotif.com was best allowing 3 adults and 1 child. Everything at hotel was excellent except the checking in which took forever. While in Paris we met up with several friends all visiting and they had paid a lot more for hotels and were in far worse locations.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at Novotel Paris Les Halles and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: ociTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Novotel Paris for 4 nights in July 2011. Starting with our check-in until our check-out it was an excellent experience. The staff was really friendly and helpful (including communicating in English); the room was great - spacious, tidy and well furnished.
