The Novotel breakfast was hearty and healthy (and plenty :) The location was central Paris (near Les Halles and Chatelet metro stations) and walking distance from all major attractions like Louvre, Cathedral etc. Best of all they provided currency exchange facilities at the main desk (was not available at the other hotels we stayed - Hilton Leeds and Holiday Inn NY). Overall we are happy customers and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in Paris for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: ArtCapella
Reviews.Content: I've spent a night in Novotel Les Halles, with my family (two kids) . The hotel rooms are good, clean and new , and the hotel has a very central location, making it easier to visit the main touristic spots. The hotel service was amazing everytime we needed it, and they could even borrow us a stroller to use with our younger kid. The hotel has also a "fun" area for smaller kids that's really interesting. We've a great value perception

Reviews.Title: “Great (but too short) stay”
Reviews.Author: kpth
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Novotel Les Halles on the last night of our 2-week trip to France and had a great stay. The hotel location is just great. From there, we could easily walk to the the river. We didn't have time to enjoy all hotel facilities, but we'll definitely be back. The room was very nice and the staff were very helpful. It's a nice place when travelling with kids. Our daughter loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrekkerr
Reviews.Content: It's so good to be downtown and have everything at your door step! Even the RER to the airport is at breath's reach. You'll appreciate that when it's time to leave and you're dead tired!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice, mainly if you are travelling with kids !!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryDomRep
Reviews.Content: Just stayed with a group from my Travel Agency and the Hotel has great facilities for parents travelling along with kids or teenagers. All rooms have a double full bed plus a sleeper sofa bed for 2 . Toilet is separated from bathroom shower, which makes a lot easier sharing a bathroom with the family. Excelent Breakfast from 6am until 10am. There is a construction on the back part of the Hotel , that will only affect you if you plan to sleep in late, but who will do that in Paris ???..Close to Rue de Rivoli with lots of shops and Restaurant, and waking distance to Notre Dame and Louvre. Only handicap, buses cannot stop in front or close by, since the street is to narrow, it will have to park couple of squares away. Also there is a funny neighborhood when you exit the Hotel to your left, do not walk that area, walk in front towards Rue de Rivoli or Rue Saint Denis.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: OZMIK
Reviews.Content: Room - Freshly renovated with views (not disturbed by construction noise). Reasonable size especially when compared to other major cities like New York, London. Staff - always smiling and willing to help. Food - Breakfast had good selection even for the health conscious. Dinner was good too if you want to stay in. ( There are also plenty of food choices nearby) Our kids used the XBox & watched cartoon network in English. There was always a guys making balloons animals for the kids and they were given colouring in etc. We were very happy of our stay and location was so handy to everything. (PS try to visit St Eustache for the free organ recital on Sun at 5:30pm. 5 min walk away)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: StevenandCecile
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent if you want to visit all of Paris (near metro lines, easy access from Airport with the RER B). There was some major contruction/renovation all around the hotel which was a disapointment, some roads were closed off and some passages. Hotel itself is very nice, modern design, nice piano bar, good breakfast (not sure it's worth it though, when you have so many restaurants nearby for more or less the same price). The room was nice, bathroom was very ordinary and just clean enough to say it's ok. No wifi in the rooms but you have a cable to get basic internet access, free. There were a lot of families with kids, which was surprising to us given the prices of the rooms. Overall, it's a nice hotel, friendly staff, good room. I found it was a bit expensive for what you get, but maybe that's just what you get for being in downtown Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to Musee Lourve & Cathedral Notre Dame. RER Station is just 1 min from Hotel. 1 RER (B line) from Europe Star (Nord), same line around 45 min straight to airport. Lots of resturants, fast food shops and supermarkets nearby. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very tiny room, good location. Beware of pickpockets around the square”
Reviews.Author: MacGiv
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for one night, before our rented apartment was ready. The location is great, right next to Chatelet-Les Halles. Steps from the metro and restaurants everywhere. My kids loved the proximity to all the crepe stands.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Jbhanap
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family. You can't beat the location! 5 minutes walk from Louvre, Pompidou centre, st Germaine, etc. and right above the metro station.Service was great and staff attitude was exemplary. You can't go wrong if you stay here. We would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Paris Les Halles is a perfect location for a Parisian stay -- with a few caveats. On the plus side, one can walk to most of the most famous sites. Those not inclined to walk are well served by the nearby Chatelet Metro station. There are many restaurants and shops of all kinds. But there is construction that will last several more years -- the rebuilding of the Forum Les Halles, which causes limited car access to the hotel entrance. Access is available, but rerouted enough to make a taxi ride a bit more expensive at any time when there is traffic. The room we had faced the central courtyard and we heard no construction. The immediate area is a bit seedier than in previous years, and local friends advised not going more than a few streets north of Les Halles any more. On the other hand, the Marais is a short walk in another direction, and 5 minutes south brings one to the Left Bank and its myriad restaurants. All rooms apparently have queen beds, and the "executive" room we booked had a fold-out couch for our teen. Quarters were cramped but doable. Nice bathroom, and bathrobes. Coffee machine made good expresso, but we had to remind the staff to replace the coffee pods, and we ended up washing out our cups daily. There was also supposed to be a water bottle daily, but there was not. Tap water is fine, though on the 90 degree day we arrived, having had a bottle to go walking with would have saved a euro or two [daily]. Kids also stay free in their parents' rooms, and the hotel was full of families. We took advantage of an offer to pay in advance for a significantly reduced room rate. We share other TripAdvisor reviews' advice: skip the overpriced buffet breakfast (18 euro per adult, children free). Many nearby cafés offer more standard French fare (coffee and bread or croissant) as well as American breakfasts at much better prices. Similarly, dinner was uninspiring and pricey both à la carte and buffet (25 euros). We ate in just once after an exhausting day, but would have done much better steps away. There is also a fabulous little bakery 3 blocks away (Boulangerie Julien, rue St. Honoré) which also sells sandwiches and other carry-out food. Service was courteous and fluent in several languages. We know the city very well, speak French, travel often, and would definitely stay at the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Paris - average service - area under renovation”
Reviews.Author: cdman12
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location. Center of Paris near main metro station. Can accomodate children in same room. Good breakfast. Drawbacks: the whole area is undergoing renovations for the next years to come. Clientele - family are ok but the rest so so. Service is average. we arrived late for breakfast and we were refused. They sent us to the bar area where we had to repay...On the 4th floor, we smell the smoke from 3rd floor smokers. We really feel we are in a hotel chain... When the hotel would order a cab for us the charge was starting at 20 euro...

Reviews.Title: “Don't.”
Reviews.Author: juliet83
Reviews.Content: Bland. Characterless. And you're paying central Paris prices for what's more like an airport hotel with a better location. You can find better.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, staff need to learn customer service”
Reviews.Author: Benzar Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, rooms are basic and clean, standard for Novotel. Location is central but neighbourhood is a little on the dirty side, rubbish all over the streets, even right in front of the hotel. Staff need to smile once in a while, not very welcoming and not very helpful with directions to local sights. This hotel may suit a business traveller who already knows the city.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Holiday 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1.Staff are polite and helpful. 2, Quality of breafast can be further improved. 3. Location are excellent but it is very difficult for finding the hotel by driving even with two GPS prompting,Novetel signboard are generally too small to identify on the roadside,may be the hotel can provide better roadmap to guide the driving Novotel hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the excellent location”
Reviews.Author: YarraValley7
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel for its location. It is within easy walking distance of the Louvre, the Pompidou Centre and Notre Dame. Considering its location (Arrondissment 1) I thought the cost was reasonable. My husband, adult daughter and I stayed for 3 nights on the 4th Floor facing the front of the hotel, in a Superior Queen room with no breakfast included. I had learned through my research that there are plenty of restaurants nearby and a small supermarket, so we made our own breakfasts. The rooms have tea/coffee making facilities and you are allowed to use their fridges for your own items. (You may need to remove some of their cans etc. and don’t forget to tell them if you are not consuming any of their mini bar items because there’s a sensor that tells reception when the fridge has been used.) We found all the reception staff pleasant and easy to deal with. We do not speak French so we would always approach people (anywhere in France) by saying, “Bonjour, parlez-vous l’anglais?” We also always said merci when people helped us. (I had read that the French have a reputation of often being rude to foreigners. I am pleased to stay we found all the French people we dealt with to be polite and helpful.) We had dinner at the hotel’s restaurant on the first night and found the meal and service very good. Unfortunately on our last evening, due to a staff shortage we (along with 2 other families) walked out of the restaurant due to the long wait/no service. We thought the lobby area of this hotel was quite impressive. There are 2 computers (with internet) available for free for the guests and one night whilst we were using them, we were entertained by the pianist playing in the hotel’s bar area. The rooms themselves were the smallest (for 3 people) we encountered during our whole UK/European trip but we didn’t mind too much as we were only in them to sleep. My daughter said the sofa bed was quite comfortable. Noise from the construction going on around the hotel did not disturb us.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: kkmumbai Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: They clearly do not understand customer service. Insensitive to customers needs and not the best place to ask for help especially if ur Asian. Not willing to gives change even though it was a bank holiday and I was helpless. Managed to get it only after speaking to the Director of the hotel. Also, the air conditioning was not functioning properly and inspire of repeated calls to the front desk they just did not bother to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Worfsdad
Reviews.Content: I left this hotel a little over 2 weeks ago. After reading the reviews, i was excited about staying here, and i can understand why some people walk away very happy. however, as with any hotel, if you interact with a poor staff member, it can really have an impact on your stay. Let me get the BAD out of the way first. Bad. There was a staff member on the front desk -- let's call her Blondie with Black euro glasses -- who was older and should have been more mature than the others. When i called the front desk (maid service was not an option on the phone) to ask for my in-room coffee to be replenished (they failed to do it earlier in the day), she first asked if i spoke any language besides English (she asked in English). when i told her what i wanted in French, she laughed hysterically and essentially told me that was not her job (in English again). i mean she laughed, and laughed, and laughed. started talking to other people around her. when i asked who i should call, she hung up. i reported her to the manager, who was kind enough to offer an apology, but i don't think he truly understood how humiliating and upsetting her attitude was to me. Then, the next day, i go to pick up my rental car to check out. there is a lot of construction going on in the area, but i made my way back to the hotel where i was confronted with a sign to the narrow parking lot driveway in front that was marked "entry forbidden." so i thought I'd missed the entrance and was looking at the exit. i parked the car out of the way to go inside and ask the front desk where to park while i gathered my luggage. before i could enter, Blondie with her black euro glasses comes running out SCREAMING that i could not park there. I said very calmly that i was just walking inside to find out where i should park, and her response was basically unintelligible, other than 'you can't park there' and she turned her back to me and went inside. Another gentleman politely told me that i could indeed use the entrance there. when i returned to check out, Blondie gave me a big smile, did not recognize me at all, or she is simply bipolar, and asked if she could help me. i stayed away. i was leaving so did not report this to the management again. she ruined an otherwise decent stay. The only other negative is that they do a lousy job replenishing the coffee service or supplying coffee mugs. also, note that the wired internet does not cost anything, but most of the staff won't tell you that. Good. i was not put off by the construction at Les Halles. no noise on my side. Room was fine except for the funky standalone toilet room separated from the sink and bathroom, noted by others. The bed was comfortable as was my 14 y.o. sleep sofa. The front desk staff was always polite and most were friendly -- except Blondie. some were a little more knowledgeable and friendly than others, but they always tried to help. the lady in the tourist office off the lobby was very helpful and friendly. Food was fine, though a bit expensive. Neighborhood was great. We asked for dinner recommendations of several staff members but it wasn't until the last night that we realized the best area was not between the hotel and the Seine, but the opposite direction. there are a ton of restaurants there. stay away from the touristy ones in the square toward Seine, although we did like the nearby Beirut Cafe. Great metro access although the exits can get very confusing. It is an easy walk to many great sites, especially the Louvre and Notre Dame. I'd probably return some day were it not for the bad experience with Blondie. with her, it seemed to higlight a few of the shortcomings of the hotel. it is fine, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE, WILL NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE”
Reviews.Author: belle_henry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 separate ocassions as we're travelling around Europe so we spent the first 3 days of our 15 days trip and returned again on the 14th day to catch our plane back to Singapore. Throughout our stay in Europe, Novotel Les Halles Paris is the worst with Novotel Milano following close behind. They messed up our room, giving us key card for room 349 when room 349 DID NOT EXIST! Then when we asked the receptionist, she DID NOT APOLOGIZE and gave us another key card for a SMOKING ROOM when we have booked IN ADVANCE for a non-smoking room!! The room is terrible small, dirty and the blanket for the sofa bed looked like it had not been washed for ages! The Manager was rude and again, she DID NOT APOLOGIZE for the smoking room mix-up! We just had a 1.5 hour flight from Milano and got detained for 2 hours for suspicious baggage at immigration of some passenger travelling in the same plane and all we wanted to do was to rest and instead found ourselves running up and down the lift for 2 different mistakes that the hotel caused! HORRIBLE! WILL NEVER STAY IN THIS HOTEL EVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, wanderful location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about. Good service (reception, concierge, restaurant and breakfast), people kind and helpful although formal. We appreciated the presence of a small play room for children at ground floor, close to the restaurant. The restaurant offers a limited number of good quality dishes. We had a family room (a double bed + a sofa with two single, regular sized, beds): clean and rational, could have been a bit larger. The wardrobe was small for a family: unsuitable for long staying. Silent during the night. Fantastical location: in the very heart of Paris, just in front of Les Halles, a few minutes walking from Centre Pompidou, Louvre, Notre Dame, Pont Neuf... Being very close to les Halles metro station and Chetelet-Les Halles RER station, it allows fantastic connection to CdG and Orly airports, Disneyland Paris and metro network. I have been walking in the center of the town and nearby the hotel at night and it looked to be safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not a great choice for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: christianmp
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Novotel Les Halles (18-26 June). All in all, the this is a good hotel. However, I ran into two major annoyances while staying here. 1. No ironing boards available in the hotel. There are no ironing boards in the rooms and when I woke up to prepare for work I called the front desk to have one delivered and found that there are only 12 ironing boards for the entire 285-room hotel. I was told 3 days ago that one would be delivered to my room as soon as it became available. Still waiting... 12 ironing boards for 285 rooms?! Who decided that was adequate?! 2. The housekeeping staff ignores your do not disturb signs. My schedule called for later nights which resulted in daytime sleep. Every morning the housekeeping staff ignored my DND sign, knocked and opened my door for cleaning until I told them "no thank you". I called the front desk who said that they would inform housekeeping to honor the do not disturb sign but housekeeping disregarded the sign and woke me every day of my stay. With this policy why do they bother providing the DND signs to their guests? Here's the good stuff: 1. Room was available for early check-in 2. Front desk service is efficient and friendly 3. Wired internet is free, fast and reliable 4. 18 Euro breakfast is good, not great, but can be considered a good value given the relative prices in Paris 5. Location, location, location. You can't beat the access to the Chatalet-Les Halles Metro and RER stations Other stuff: There is a major rehab of the Forum Des Halles which is the shopping center next to to the Novotel. I would guess that about 1/3 of the Novotel's rooms face the construction site. So, you only have a ~30% chance of getting a room that is effected by construction noise. There is definitely construction noise but not enough to keep me awake while I slept during the day. However, if you are a light sleeper or if you plan to be in your room during the day you may want to avoid this hotel until the project is complete. Judging from the scale of construction I would guess that the construction will be going on for at six months to a year (check pics). In my opinion the other reviewers may have overstated the noise level. If they straighten out the ironing board and do-not-disturb issues I would rate it as a good hotel vice the current average rating.

Reviews.Title: “For this price, too many shortcomings..”
Reviews.Author: Swaan53
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night in Novotel Les Halles. Indeed, the location is great, but that is all... During my stay too many things went wrong. 1. The tv in my room did not work. 2. I had a room at the front of the hotel (above the entrance). In the morning, at 6 am I could not sleep anymore because of continious rasping noise, caused by construction workers just outside the hotel. 3. I got a room on the "smoking" floor (unbelievable that is still possible in the EU), although I asked for a non-smoking room. The ventilation system blew smoke into my room. 4. The wireless internet was not free (as stated on my reservation confirmation), but 12 euro per day! After all, I would not pay so much money again for this poor night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “safe choice, difficult to fault but it's expensive”
Reviews.Author: ladyfromwestlondon
Reviews.Content: this is a really great hotel in a fantastic location the views over les halles are magnificent the lobby area has that sort of safe luxury international feeling that is comforting after a long journey rooms are a good size and the bathrooms are really smart. would definitely go again but only with the last minute reduction i received at over 300 E a night it seems a little too much though if i had the money i'd book it for a week! has a sense about it that the people staying have a lot of money only flaw is the beds are a bit squeaky and with the location as it is night time shouting outside is inevitable.

Reviews.Title: “A good holiday base”
Reviews.Author: procell
Reviews.Content: Having arrived 30th of May from Charles de Gaul airport,the location of the Hotel was excellently located,adjacent to the chatlet les halles train station. R E R blue line direct. Checkin was fast and efficient with a good understanding of English. The hotel lobby is modern fresh large and tastefully decorated. Lifts and rooms are modern with safe and all mod cons. The obligingly missing was normal English tea bags and drinking chocolate. The room was spacious wirh a good water pressure in the shower. The hotel has a very tranquil and pleasing courtyard with greenery and plants surrounding an eating area. Internet and wifi is available free in the lobby and ground floor areas there was a pianist in the evenings.the location to the sights was within reach on foot and many small resteraunts with English speaking and printed menus available 3 courses for 16 euros. The hotel does not supply inclusive breakfasts. These would be quite expensive,so best to eat out. Checkout was very fast and efficient . Would definitely recommend.had a very nice experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Les Halles”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, about 30 yards from the Chatelet metro stop, if you exit out on the Sortie 10 from the Chatelet stop and take the elevator to street level. Location is excellent , right in the middle les halles, adjacent to the Forum Les Halles(mall) and the Pompidou Center (modern art museum). Lots of restaurants to choose from along with grocery stores, bakeries, and lots of retail clothing shopping all around you. The staff was helpful and provide free internet access (free with ethernet cable, not WIFI) so makes sure you ask for the cable or bring your own. It's a 4 star hotel but our room was very plain for a 4 star hotel. The sink faucet in the bathroom was hard to get to since it was placed to the side of the sink instead of in front of you as they normally are averywhere else. The cheapest night rate we got was $317, but it's typically more than that. Paris has gotten more and more expensive these days and I noticed more decay in the metro trains since the last time I was there. You get more for your buck in London these days, in case you're trying to decide between the two.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff incredible in following up my husbands lost baggage for us!”
Reviews.Author: Claire3587
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. We found it easy to walk everywhere (even if sometimes it was a little further than we expected - the eiffel tower for example) and it's also close to public transport - including the batobus on the seine which we highly recommend as a means of transport and for general sightseeing. We flew in to Paris and on arrival we discover my husbands suitcase had been left behind in KL. Staff were Incredible in helping us deal with the airlines to recover the bag (which took several days) and they were encouraging and didn't once seem to be annoyed with our continual follow up through them! We would stay here again as we felt safer here than in many parts of Paris, the rooms are very comfortable and there are many fine restaurants just out the back door.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for families too”
Reviews.Author: wasabi69Sweden
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great location and is near to a lot of sights in Paris. The near surrounding is maybe not the best and a little bit noisy at night, but you find several good places to dine at. The hotel serves a very good breakfast even if the queue can be long. Rooms are good with great bathroom. The children slept well in the extra bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good for guests new to Paris”
Reviews.Author: kmk298
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 4 day trip with my mother and 16 year old sister. Both had never been to Paris, and as our trip was short I wanted something centralized. We had a standard room with a pull-out bed/couch. It was fine for a group of three. Breakfast was very good and had a nice selection -- also big cups of coffee which my mother appreciated. The beds were not uncomfortable and the staff was helpful. Our room and bathroom was extremely clean. It didn't have the charm of a smaller hotel, and was a bit expensive, but we went for location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Electron
Reviews.Content: Super location of this hotel. 100s of cafes near by. Mall behind. Metro station at the hotel entrance. Top attractions at 5-10 minutes walking distance. Cant beat it. Free wi-fi in the lobby. Great breakfast. However, in the name of curtsey, hotel staff takes too much time to sit one family at the breakfast table. A line unnecessarily forms for breakfast everyday. Can be improved. Cute play area for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: palakgupta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near the louvre museum and shopping places... the hotel staff is very friendly and the rooms are well furnished and clean... good breakfast and bar... very enjoyable stay...

Reviews.Title: “Choose it for the location”
Reviews.Author: WandererIndia
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to its location which is close to the main subway station .There is a small courtyard behind the hotel where there are lots of food outlets and other stores.This gives the area a wonderful charm.The reception was always crowded and the check in took some time.The rooms were average and there is nothing special about the hotel.It seemed that there are other hotels close to this which are better value.It was an OK Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel for disabled guests”
Reviews.Author: Geraldvj
Reviews.Content: I brought my elderly mother to your hotel and booked saying I needed a disabled person’s room. The room was very poor. I was less cross until I was sent a customer satisfaction email survey. I filled this in but it crashed on me, presumably because I wrote in and complained. There are 5 things that you could do to improve your disabled rooms. This is the fourth time I have inputted this into your hotel chain and I am becoming very angry at the impression that you do not listen. 1. There are no alarms in the room. This is a really big problem. Alarm cords needed in bedroom and bathroom in case of falls. 2. There was a bath in a room for disabled people, really stupid. A walk in shower with a seat in it would have been good. My mother could not properly wash or bathe for her whole trip to Paris. 3. The taps have very small signs on them to say what they do, very poor for people with poor eyesight. 4. The hand grip by the toilet is in the wrong place. A second drop down bar needed on the other side of the toilet. 5. There was a big lip at the entrance to the room which was tough for anyone in a wheelchair – like my mum. For a hotel in the heart of Paris it was good, except for my disabled mother

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PGMAustralia
Reviews.Content: Had a comfortable 4 day stay at this hotel. Great central location in Paris. The hotel is built around a large internal courtyard. We had a room overlooking the courtyard, view was nothing great but nice and quiet, even managed to sleep with the window open and enjoy the warm spring Paris air. The pedestrian precincts nearby have a very cosmopolitan mix of restaurants. Notre Dame and the Lourve are both within walking distance, entrance to the Chatelet metro station is right in front of the hotel. Les Halles RER station is behind the hotel and can also be accessed via the Chatelet metro entrances.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, rooms not big, but quality ok. Breakfast average and service a bit arrogant.. At reception super service. Location is fantastic and the car can stay in the basement during the stay at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: macclesfieldgourment Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast choice was very good in light and airy restaurant. Bedroom oom very adequate. Slept like logs after pounding the streets of Paris. The location is excellent. Just a short walk from Ile de Cite (Notre Dame) and walking distance from Musee d'Orsday. Les Halles just behind hotel - however this is undergoing a major 'facelift'. It will look fab when complete (about 5 years time). We didn't experience any noise from the work, however our room was facing the inner courtyard. Desk staff were helpful in giving us info on 'open top' buses. When in France it does help to have at least a smattering of French. US reviewers please note! I guess the French don't grumble that hotel staff in the States don't speak French. When in Rome .... etc. etc. We took the RER from Charles de Gaulle. It was easy, took about 35 minutes and Chatelet les Halles station brings you right up behind the hotel (Rue Berger exit).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to visit Paris and Disney”
Reviews.Author: Pascal1
Reviews.Content: We went for a 3 days/2 nights trip to Paris with our children (6 and 4). The hotel can be easily reached by car and has its own parking garage (€ 22 per day). The reception is efficient and within 10 minutes we were in our room on the 4th floor. The room was spacious (for Paris standards, I have been in Parisian hotels where the rooms were as large as closets) and had a queen and bedsofa for the children. The metro is 30 meters from the hotel entrance and the RER (to Disney) is found through the shopping mall (Les Halles) behind the hotel. Disney is 40 min by train (RER) and restaurants/shops etc are all within walking distance. The breakfast buffet is excellent and no charge for children. Wifi coverage through the whole hotel is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff but room a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: NiffandRem
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor so thought it important to give our thoughts now that we have been there. The hotel itself is in a good location - easy access to Notre Damn, Louvre etc. The staff were very friendly and polite and the ones we dealt with all spoke English. Breakfast was a little disappointing considering all the wonderful reviews for it on this site. There is a large selection of different foods but when we tried the hot food (egg, sausage, bacon) we didn't enjoy it very much (stange tasting and a little undercooked in places). The rest of the food was good though (toast, crossaints, pain au chocolate, tea, smoothies) so as long as you don't want a cooked breakfast. The room itself was of a decent size (certianly enough room for 2 adults). It has a separate toilet from the main bathroom. The bathroom was clean enough but we did notice some hair on the ceiling above the shower and there was a lot of limescale on the sink and shower screen. The room had tea and coffee making facilities which was very handy. The bed was comfortable although the pillows were massive foam ones which was far from comfortable (we found some smaller ones in the cupboard though which were better). The WiFi available was 12 euros per day for the premium service. This was needed if you wanted to use WiFi in your room. You can however go to the lobby or bar and use free WiFi of a good speed (there is also a Mac available in the lobby). The room in general was starting to look a little shabby - carpet worn in places, skirting boards messy, paint coming away in places. It was however acceptable and we did enjoy our stay. Would we stay again? Yes - the location was very good (there is a square just around the corner with many restaurants, shops, cafes etc - they are also re-devloping the shopping centre in this area - see previous review which notes building work noises. We didnt experience these as we were at the front of the hotel though).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DevonHare
Reviews.Content: Ideal location and nice hotel. My only minor quib is that thye queue for breakfast was a little long. Apart from that excellent

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Location Service Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: anty77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with my mum and my sister and we couldnt have chosen a better hotel! Breakfast is at 6:30am and is a MUST for anyone staying here. Buffet has anything you could ask for: cold meats, hot sausages, cheeses, potato, mushroom, best crossaints we had in paris, crepes, jam, toast, yougurt, fruit, cereal and the service here is suberb. The staff are all very helpful, and greeted us all the time, (my sister and I) especially loved the manager, cant remember his name but he was an African man who did our check in and had a lovely suit on each morning! The room was a lot smaller than I thought it would be as we had the Executive Suite and the mini bar was a bit over priced. LOCATION was perfect! the shopping centre was right behind us along with several cafes and restaurants just a few minutes walk. There was two Metro lines one directly in front of the hotel and the other under the shopping centre this was very handy. And we walked to Notredam (15 min walk) and Louvre (also 15 min other way) staff gave us a marked map! Also free WiFi was so handy! Would 100% stay here next time I go to Paris and recommend to anyone no matter what age!

Reviews.Title: “Great for people with kids”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloPundit
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious, featuring a very comfortable sofabed that will accommodate 2 kids. The regular bed is about a queen size, and remarkably comfortable. We slept very well throughout our week. There is extensive construction going on at Les Halles behind the hotel, and the neighborhood can get a bit drunken and rowdy, so our room overlooking the courtyard was ideally quiet. I was concerned about issues regarding the A/C, but it worked just fine for us. Note that the Nespresso is now replaced with a fast-acting kettle and Nescafe packets. The minibar is set to automatically charge if you open the door and move stuff around. But we did that to accommodate some milk for the kids & coffee, and some yogurts, and let the staff know at check-out that nothing was consumed and they took the charge off the bill. Insaf at the tourist office was especially helpful in obtaining for us a very hard-to-get dinner reservation at Frenchie. I made it a point to thank her in person. Check-out was smooth, but check-in was a bit late and we were made to wait some time. We did not opt for breakfast, as the area has numerous bistros and crepe / croissant vendors nearby. The Citadines next door has a convenience store that also serves beer and wine (it's also undergoing a major renovation, so that may affect future ratings). The only negative was some limited dresser/closet space and the fact that the ceiling above the shower had mold spots, and the shower door itself was somewhat leaky. These things could use some sprucing up, but didn't detract from our stay. In all, we were quite pleased with our stay and our room and would definitely recommend it. It's one of the few hotels that will comfortably accommodate a family of four in one room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveller321
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at this hotel and absolutely loved it. The location is fabulous and gives you great access to all the local attractions. Tons of restaurants in the local area as well as great shopping. Even though i was on my own, i felt safe in the area day and nite (this was a nice suprise as i was told it could be a bit of a dodgy area...but with lots of people around and everything so close to the hotel i felt safe at all times). It has 3 metro stations within a few minutes walk of the hotel (one which is outside the front door) and this gave you lots of options for easy travel around Paris. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was comfortable, clean and very quiet - i had a room facing the hotel courtyard and it was really peaceful. It has windows which actually open and it was lovely to open up the window for some fresh air and warm sunshine. Another bonus was the easy access from CDG airport - direct RER train service to Chatelle Les Halles (2 mins from hotel) with NO steps at either end ! (great when you have a heavy bag to carry on the way home!!) Overall a great stay and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Paris Les Halles”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, within walking distance of many of the most important Paris sights. Rooms are spacious, and well-appointed, and the front desk people tend to be very helpful. It's a little pricey, but that's partly made up for by the convenience of its location. It's also become quite family friendly, which can mean lots of kids running around the lobby, restaurant, and bar areas--things can get a little noisy. On the other hand, the restaurant serves a burger that shouldn't be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not clean enough, not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: RikyCoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 17 to 20, meaning we returned yesterday from Paris. I regret to say that the experience was not enough, in terms of hotel service and maintenance. It started getting the room late, rather than at 12:00 at 15:00. Although the hotel manager offered compensation with a family meal voucher at the bar, it didnt left a good taste: when we got the room turned out that he is not clean enough, and unfortunately there were hairs in the bath. Also the shower hose was full of mold and peeling. The hotel was'nt noisy as others claimed, probably because of the holiday and freedom. The towels are very small. The beds were comfortable. The room and the hotel did not justify the payment. The reception service was good, but their guidance and orientation in the erea not always enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, within walking distance of Louvre, Notre Dame, Hotel de Ville. If arriving by train do ask the hotel for directions on how to get out of Chatelet Les Halles because there are too many exits! For the centre of Paris I think this is really good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Hotel left much to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNY07
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed in this hotel! I'm not sure where to begin... First - when we arrived - I had to use the woman's room in the lobby and it was FILTHY. 2 of the toilettes were backed up and it looked as though it hadn't been cleaned in days. But I also figured it was a Sunday so maybe the cleaning staff hadn't cleaned it over the weekend. But then we got to our room.... what a ridiculous configuration! There is a stand alone toilette as you walk in. I found it very strange to use a toilette in one little room without a sink to wash your hands and then have to walk around into your actual sleeping area to use the rest of the bathroom. The bed was like a futon mattress. It was miserable as were the pillows. The shower head was broken in the shower and hence flooded our entire bathroom. We had also specifically requested when we made our reservation a non-smoking room and we didn't get that. When I tried to switch they were completely booked. I should point out that paris was experiencing a heat wave the day we arrived but I would think a hotel like the Novotel would be able to produce working air conditioning. They could not and the only reason they gave was the unseasonably hot weather. I know it's Europe - I get the whole air conditioning thing in Europe - but it was a sauna in our room! We had to sleep with our windows completely wide open which wasn't the most comfortable with a 3 year old in the room. We did get the crib we requested - it was a portable crib which was fine but it had holes in the sides of it. Nothing special. Our room faced the courtyard area in the middle of the hotel which was loud at night with people having drinks. Would not be an issue if the air conditioning worked. I will say that over all the staff were very friendly and the short walk to Notre Dame was lovely. But the area wasn't my favorite in Paris and the hotel was definitely not enough to make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmaedinburgh77
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely few days here. The price was so good that I was expecting it to be a bit grotty but it was a lovely, clean, modern, welcoming hotel and suited our family very well. The area is undergoing some building work to the Forum Les Halles shopping centre but this didn't disturb us at all and there were so many great restaurants nearby. We thought the breakfast cost was too high but when we went out to get a breakfast locally we realised what excellent value the hotel version was. This was a good spot to access all areas of Paris both walking and by Metro. Impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: stillsomuch2see
Reviews.Content: I travelled in a party of 3 ladies ready for a nice citytrip weekend in Paris. We booked the room with a double bed and double sofa bed. Really nice was that the sofa bed actually pulls out as 2 separate single beds so that fitted our needs perfect. The size was good,, it was clean and had everlything one need for a 2 night stay (including free wifi). The only downside was that our room overlooked the breakfast area and was inside the Atrium so we couldn't open our window. The first night was not so comfortable, the ariconditioning didn't work it blew heat instead of cold air and we could't get fresh air in because the window couldn't open. We went to the reception in the morning and asked if they could have a look at the airco. We got another, even bigger room, because indeed the airco seemed to have been broken. The new room got 2 sofa beds and 1 double bed. Also a really nice bonus if you travel with friends is that the toilet is not in the bathroom but is separated which is great if you are like us with 3 ladies needing the bathroom in the morning. Yes they are building next to the hotel but our 2nd room was looking out to this and we slept the whole night with the window open and no one of us had significant issues with noise as some other reviews mention. For light sleepers in a city just a tip - earplugs will do the trick as well if it really bothers you. The location is great. Right next to the best connected metro line from Paris and within walking distance from Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou, Louvre,... The areas / rooms I have seen have been fairly recently renovated and you can really tell and I think they can only benefit from it. At breakfast we did notice there were a lot of families with children and larger groups so if you only want to have a romantic, quite,private get-a-way with your signifiant other this might not be your first choice but for me and my friends it was perfect. Good value for money (breakfast included), great location, friendly staff (not a given in Paris) and good size rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Novotel welcome!”
Reviews.Author: LondonFrancophile73
Reviews.Content: I have just returned back from a weekend at the Novotel Paris Les Halles with 4 friends (2 nights). We were very impressed by the welcome from the staff, in particular the Barman on Fri 1/4 and Sat 2/4 was extremely hospitable. The location is great, minutes from Chatelet (take the exit no.6), the decor is nice in the public areas and breakfast was very good offering a good variety. We stayed at the back of the hotel. It was very quiet. The rooms are a good size for Paris and the bathrooms are modern and very clean. The bed was comfortable and the pillows very soft. My only complaint is that the room was very hot but it was easy to open the window to cool down. This is my second stay at this Novotel. My first visit was 1988 when I was 14, with my parents and the hotel was very new. I visit Paris about 3 times a year with family and friends and will definitely come back again with my children as it offers excellent value for money, is comfortable and the staff are excellent. Many thanks for a lovely stay. Nicola Sheppard

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AReviewer59
Reviews.Content: A good hotel very well located near Pompidou Centre and within an easily walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame. Clean, efficient, helpful. No complaints. Breakfasts are expensive and you are as well going to one of the very many nearby cafes. Lots of nearby restaurants and a couple of small supermarkets nearby. I recommend the OpenTour Buses to anyone visiting Paris for the first time and suggest you pre-book your Eiffel Tower tickets on-line before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply ordinary rooms - poor value for money, despite great location”
Reviews.Author: Hackneylady
Reviews.Content: This is a chain hotel, so you can't expect much in the way of character. And I should caveat all of this by saying that the staff were very friendly and helpful. But that couldn't make up for what I found to be pretty poor quality rooms, which represented bad value for money. You can do much better elsewhere in Paris. For instance - The shower in my room was broken - I had to wedge a piece of paper in it to make the showerhead stay up at the right height. The water coming from the bathroom tap smelled bad, for the duration of my stay. The pillows were really uncomfortable. The room was kind of poky, and had a terrible view. There's also no wi-fi in the rooms. The room, and bathroom in particular, could have done with re-decorating. It was grubby around the edges. In general, it didn't feel like a comfortable or welcoming room. The location, just off Rue de Rivoli, is great. But for the prices chargef, I found it very poor value and wouldn't recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: willtori
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything, but the eiffel tower, if you do the subway not to bad. The hotel is in a fun neighborhood with alot going on. The only negative for me was the communication with the hotel staff, very few English speaking staff membrs.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad word for this excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaine76650
Reviews.Content: not a bad word for this hotel - stayed in paris many times and knew this hotel was central - near the best shops, on the central rer line to access most attractions without changing train/metro/underground etc. hotel was so clean, beds very comfy - didnt want to leave! good views of city and church from hotel. service brilliant and breakfast choice was out of this world! 5 choices of breakfast - continental, meats, fresh fruit, yoghurt, fry ups!breads, condiments - the works! so pleased with this hotel. good for business, families, couples - plenty of all types of customers there! notre dame and le louvre around 15 mins walk from here. free entry to notre dame. best to get metro to sacre coeur/eiffel tower etc. you can get a "mobilis" travel card for a day and is only 11.90 euros per person and covers most attractions and can hop on and off metro without buying all individual singles tickets! really handy. i used to live in paris so if you need any advise about area or more about this hotel, feel free to contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - service needs a bit of work”
Reviews.Author: threecats14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - very central. We were forewarned about undesirables hanging about at night outside the nearby shopping centre and kept vigilant whilst out walking at night but we had no trouble at all There are extensive building works nearby but this didnt cause any problems either didnt Although desk staff were polite and helpful we had to ask several times for milk for our room which didnt materialise so we tracked down the housekeeper who promptly provided us with plenty We also had to ask for the fold up bed to be made up - This didnt happen either so at 2200hrs we made it ourselves.The hotel room was far too warm but sleeping with the window open didnt bother us at all At checkout we were presented with a bill for breakfast although out breakfasts were included so had to wait to get that sorted out before we could check out

Reviews.Title: “Not so charming...”
Reviews.Author: msspiderman
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a night on a business trip and we were glad we didn't know the price until we were checking out...It is such a ordinary hotel that we can hardly remember any details while writing this review. What we can remember is that the pictures on the website did not match at all with our room. But we didn't care as we thought we had a cheap hotel anyway. Only when we learned that our night was € 256 we were shaking our head. Our tip: order breakfast to your room -> the hotel is warning you already in the elevators to come between 8-9 for breakfast as you have to expect long waiting times. Restaurant obviously doesn't live up to the capacity the hotel can run. Location is ok but nothing special, neighbourhood looks rather dirty and across the street broken windows on the pavement in front of a shop on were telling a burglary story.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TokyoV
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Location is great. I could walk everywhere from Les Halles even though the metro station nearby is also extremely convenient. Plenty of food outlets and supermarkets nearby to find groceries and take-aways. -Service is friendly and efficient. I had a problem with a squeaky mattress on my first night. The lady at the front desk was very quick at moving me to a room with a new mattress. She informed me they were currently changing the mattress of some of the rooms. -My second room seemed to have been renovated compared to the first. The quality seemed much better as it included both a bathtub with a separate shower booth, a sofa-bed, a Nespresso machine and more bathroom amenities. -Free wi-fi internet! High-speed comes at an extra cost but the free service was sufficient for my needs. -Cleanliness was consistent in both of my rooms. Cons: -Les Halles is going through major renovations. I could hear some of the hammering from my room. I'm not sure how this hotel will fare in the next few years as this project is progressing. No doubt this hotel will be in a perfect location once the renovations are completed. -There seems to be some inconsistency in the room quality. My first room looked old and tired. The mattress was squeaky, there was only a bathtub without a shower curtain and the desk was missing its chair. -The TV system seemed to be defective in both rooms. Some channels would not have sound while others only played sound from one of the speakers. -Night-time in Les Halles may seem a little unsafe. I could hear shouting from the streets in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and area near sights”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTravelBug
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Paris and I enjoyed this Hotel very much. Everyone at the front desk was helpful in telling us the easist way to get around to see the sights. Close by are wonderful restuarants and shopping. Also close by are several grocery stores and the metro ( which is kinda confusing) . The breakfast was included with our package and there was a lot to choose from including eggs, meats , pototoes, great bread items The best part for us was the bar area. We thought that Kamel the bartender was very sweet. On Thursday night they had a D-Jay playing some great world music. I would highly recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “poor service, no character”
Reviews.Author: LitoGreece
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fun of the big hotels, that I must admit. But even so, my experience was one of the worst. I had to call 3 times at the reception desk to get a pair of slippers (mind you, I did the 3 calls within 5 hours, not every 5'). Having a light dinner at the hotel bar, we had to wait quite enough to get the attention of the only person being there to attend all customers (it wasn't his fault). And in the morning, there was a cockroach on one of the breakfast counters. A small one, but still... Overall, it was like a "super-market hotel": most of them look all alike, and you shouldn't have high expectations

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lancashire_cruisers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend trip to Paris and I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for families. It is situated in a great central location, even though you do have to navigate the unbelievably confusing Chatelet metro station. The reception desk staff had a friendly and professional attitude and our daughter was thrilled with the gift she received. There is a tourist information area to the right of reception and, whilst we didn't use it, it looked very well stocked with brochures, leaflets, maps, etc. and was manned during business hours. Our 5th floor room was clean and extremely comfortable. There was a bit of traffic noise as our room overlooked the front of the hotel, but it wasn't enough to cause any major concerns. Overall I was really happy that we'd chosen this hotel for our stay in Paris and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recently refurbished”
Reviews.Author: blacklab
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at this hotel, mainly for its superb location, and have always been slightly unhappy about its aspect, the bed and the breakfast. All this has changed as a result of a recent refurbishment and I can now whole-heartedly recommend the place. It is also very good value for money, considering the steep prices charged by other four-star hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Great room. Great breakfast. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: jenkinsmikeb
Reviews.Content: Made contact with hotel before leaving UK - by email. Deputy Manager, Ranata Ramos, took time to reply giving very helpful details about how to find the Hotel travelling on RER from CDG airport. Superb oversize room on sixth floor. Very quiet. Very clean. Excellent beds. Breakfast could not be faulted on choice, quality or quantity. We spent four nights here and because of the central position of the Hotel we were able to walk to all the Paris attractions. Alternatively there is an access point to the Metro outside the front door!

Reviews.Title: “Seems more like a motel then a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJVOLKER
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not up to the standard i have come to expect from the Novotel chain of hotels. It seemed more like a budget motel then a hotel, It was a convenient location but If i could do Paris over again I would not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Paris les Halles”
Reviews.Author: shazzle50 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within walking distance of all the sights in Paris. Service excellent on desk. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “location location location ! nice room, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: kuifjehaddock66
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in the hotel for sylvester. Arrived 30 dec, check in was NOT ok, we arrived at 13.30 and room was not ready, were asked to have lunch and come back at 15.00. We came back at 15.00 and room was not still ready, after complaining we got a room !! The room was nice, great view at les halles, nespresso water and free wifi that worked good. we didn!t use the breakfast, because the hotel was to busy, in the neighboorhood you can get cheap breakfast easy. metro, rer and velovib across the door +++ very nice location

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, new, modern. Good location”
Reviews.Author: ronigold
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Center of Paris and near metro. Not a far walk to notre dame. Breakfast was ok. Typical European buffet. Staff was great in helping us locate our luggage lost by airline. They all spoke great English. Very clean room and decent size, although we didn't have luggage to occupy our room for most of our stay. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I lost My pen in the safe box”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I lost a MontBlanc pen in the safe box I called the reception one day after to declare it The lady answered that my pen has been found and gave me a reference number to claim back during my next stay I went back on December 20 (room 523) and the pen was not there ...... I think it is unacceptable for a so called 4 stars Hotel

Reviews.Title: “great value, location and service for family with teen girls”
Reviews.Author: OzScotty
Reviews.Content: Our family with 2 teenage daughters stayed here just before Christmas and it was great. the location is fabulous as we caught the train in from CDG airport to Les Halles and then just a short walk if you find the right exit - Pont Neuf is good and turn left. We arrived around 8am so room was not ready so the helpful reception staff stored our bags and we had coffee in the lobby and went for a walk, coming back around 10.30am when our room was ready. We had room 401 which was quite spacious consisting of a double bed for the adults, 1 pull-out double sofa (very thin mattress) and 2 pull out singles which had good quality mattress. Pillows are pretty average. Only small complaint was that the top shelf of the cupboard was a bit dusty which we found out when we threw our coats up there. We didnt have free wi-fi but used the lobby Apple Macs for internet access although they were quite often occupied. Breakfasts were substantial and was included in our rate, strangely though the first morning was not included. When you have two teens who eat for free it really is great value. Front desk staff were always very helpful and happy to give advice and organise things like taxi. We had so much luggage that we decided to skip the metro to Orly and take a maxi-taxi for about 50 euros which was not much more than metro and a lot less hassle, especially in the snow. The location was fabulous and there was only 1 street close by that felt a bit seedy at night. Big shopping mall just 2 mins walk, all the fast food restaurants you need, other restaurant options - Hippopotamous was good for a family and a supermarket just 5 mins walk - handy for buying snack lunches (in hotel room) and bottled water, which is much more economical than eating at restaurants all the time. Metro is right at the front door although you must make sure to ask concierge for the name of the exit which is Line 4 Rue de Lingerie as the Chatelet station is huge and gets confusing when you are underground. The Marais district (Place des Voges), Louvre, Notre Dame, etc are all within 15 mins walk. Great hotel and highly recommend for an economical stay for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were very good and always polite and helpful and the hotel well located for shopping and the metro station and shopping center just next door. Generally the food in the dining room was quite good with a good selection, however we paid quite a lot for a lobster 'special' and it was dry and seriously overcooked. The only recompense to us was the comment from the waitress that she would tell the chef and a single scoop of icecream with our desert. This was disappointing when this special cost so much. I would stay here again but be a little more carefull about expensive specials in future.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LL88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and got a room with a king size bed and a double sofa bed for my daughters (both 10 year old). The room is huge and new. Bath room is with separate shower. Very nicely done up. The cleaner will tidy your room everyday and top up the coffee/tea corner for you. Receptionist at the check in counter is very friendly and speak good English. The breakfast is sumptous too with Euro 17.30 per adult and Child eat for free. We ate breakfast everyday in the hotel restaurant. Not forgetting there is free Wifii for your stay in this hotel.... How cool was that! Hotel is well located in the central. RER/Metro station just behind the hotel. Pizza hut, Mc donalds, KFC all round the corners... I would stongly recommend this hotel to anyone who are going to Paris for holiday. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was excellent, the room was very good and loved the service!”
Reviews.Author: uidzero
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff spoke better english than my broken French. They were very friendly and courteous. Loved the in room coffee service. The hotel staff found an issue with the room and resolved it straight away. This is the first time at a Novotel in Paris and must say it was a bit better than the Novotel stay in London. However I do not think I would have picked the Novotel in Paris if my experience in London was bad. Suffice to say, I cannot wait until my next trip to Paris. By the way - this hotel is very easy to get to from CDG airport and has direct access to anywher in Paris via the underground. Also the management staff at the hotel is highly customer focused!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in central Paris.”
Reviews.Author: hzech
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my sister, 3 nights Paris. We certainly made the right choice on this hotel. Reasonably priced, most centrally located, spacious, clean rooms, friendly staff and an amazing breakfast. We were able to walk to most places we wanted to see and were able to rest comfortable every night. Great, great choice. Would recommend it any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: unar1
Reviews.Content: Location is very good - walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre, right next to Chatlet metro station. Good restaurants - including quick takeout panini's & crepe's. Our favourite - outdoor food market on Thursdays on Rue Montmartre (behind St. Eustache Church) - pickup a baguette, ham/salami, chicken, cheese and wine for a very nice meal. Note - Chatlet / Les-Halles underground metro station is somewhat big and confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but just a typical big chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarsBar68
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of Notre Dame, Pompideau Centre and the Seine with Chatelet metro station (exit 10 I think) right outside the hotel entrance that links you to all other attractions easily. Breakfast is very busy after 9.00 at weekends and very ordinary for a 4star hotel. It is very plentiful, however with the usual selection of food although we were disappointed by the cold pancakes and bland scrambled egg. There are loads of cafes surrounding the hotel which I am sure would offer a cheaper, more authentic french breakfast. We had a 6th floor room which was an odd shape and had a sloped ceiling which restricted headroom - so mind your heads. Room was clean and comfortable. Good bag storage facilities are available after you have checked out and if you are continuing your sightseeing. TIP: if going up the Eiffel Tower, book your tickets online before going to avoid the long queues.

Reviews.Title: “Central and clean but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: suitcasebandit
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced hotel in a central location. Les Halles isn't the nicest central area, but the hotel is 4 minutes from the Seine and 5 from the Louvre. The rooms are clean, the balcony is good with an opening window, the bed confortable, and the shower was fine. No bath, and the corridor was depressing. There was a mix up with the bill at the end and they only had one cashier on check-out. Overall this hotel is fine but absolutely nothing special. On the basis that Paris is full of characterful hotels I probably wouldn't miss never going back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_MJ
Reviews.Content: Expensive breakfast. No fitness room. Bar is underserviced and expensive. Staff is ok, but not well trained. Many rooms have a window to the restaurant and not the street, which feels weird. A/C too warm in the coolest level.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, does exactly what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: chicomcchappy
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Paris, this hotel is perfect for location. You can walk to most of the main sightseeing spots such as Lovre, & Notre Dam, & shopping areas. There is an underground satation just outside the door too. The lobby area and bar is quite nice but €12 a pint is a bit much for a novotel bar. There are lots of nice places to reat and get lunch etc very close to this Novotel. If i was going to Paris again i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: Alexandriatraveler18
Reviews.Content: We cannot praise this hotel enough. The staff was courteous, helpful and went out of their way to secure tickets to the sold-out Monet exhibit at the Grand Palais. Although there is a Metro station adjacent to the hotel, we never had to use it because the hotel's central location enabled us to walk to all the sites and neigborhoods we wished to visit, including the Louvre and Notre Dame. The rooms were immaculate, and sound proofed, with comfortable beds and bed linens. The breakfast buffet was astounding: croissants, eggs, meats, fruit, cheese, cereal and more.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is socks”
Reviews.Author: Manarmaged
Reviews.Content: Room style is ok but very unclean and the service is socks .I changed my room as the first one was full of dust and hair. When the houskeeing wanted to clean the room, I asked her to come after an hour, she said tomorrow then!!!! I asked for a babycot and got it after 45 minutes after three calls. It is a four star hotel without any standards of service. May be this is the usual standard of service in Paris as I heard from others that most hotels there lack service, but no excuse for cleanliness. Location is nice as it is near down town and many places.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: traxlan
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Paris, we stayed at the Novotel Les Halles. The location is fantastic, the metro station Les Halles and a big shopping mall right in front of the hotel. The room is modern and handy. Wifi is free in the hotel lobby and if you are lucky, also in some of the rooms. Our room had two sofabeds in it which is very handy when travelling with little children. Only negative point was the rather thin walls which lets you hear every noise and voice in the hallways. But we would stay again in this hotel as for a city hotel, it offers very good value for price

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl71044
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Paris Les Halles for 6 nights -- a family of 4 in a Superior Room. The kids slept on the pull out sofa, which was slightly wider that a double bed. It worked out fine since they are both small (ages 7 & 10), but if they were much bigger it might have been uncomfortable. The room was small, especially once the sofa was opened, but we didn't spend much time in the room. The rooms were cleaned well every day, but we always had to request extra towels. The location, as other reviews have mentioned, is ideal for sightseeing in Paris with easy access to multiple Metro lines and easy walking distance to Notre Dame and the Louvre (the kids never complained about the walking!) There is a supermarket just two blocks for stocking up on snacks and water and there is a wide variety of restaurants, cafes, patisseries, and creperies (even a Pizza Hut, McDonald's and KFC). The neighborhood was vibrant by day and was safe at night especially since there was a significant police presence (that fact did make us wonder). The hotel staff was extremely helpful and courteous and the hotel restaurant had options that pleased both adult and kids (although, for some reason, they serve red wine cold). The guests at the hotel were almost entirely European and were a mix of families with children and business travelers. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Its a great value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie153
Reviews.Content: Loved the Novotel their service was amazing and the room was so clean and modern l would recommend this hotel to others travelling to Paris It was centrally located and staff were so polite great hotel!!! sydney

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: damsel71
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our threenight stay very late on the first night and the check in staff were wonderful. They processed our check in very quickly, were very friendly and even gave thekids some gifts (which were very unexpected and appreciated). The location is the real selling point of this hotel. Brilliant to walk to many touristy type attractions. Great cafes, restaurants and bars in the immediate area and loads of shopping (not exactly high class Parisian designer label shops, but heaps in the area). We ate breakfast in the hotel only once and it was good that thekids were free. It was extremelybusy though. The touist office located in the lobby is a fantastic wealth of information and they will happily book tours, dinners etc for you. Our room was good and clean with everything we needed. The corridor traffic was not too noisy either.

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FrostKitty
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, fantastic, for visiting Paris on first time. The rooms are comfortable , I've stayed on better 4* hotels but you pay for the beautiful city and the location. The breakfast in stead was kind of poor and they served until 9.30 only, for me it was too early to woke up, but what bothered me was the fact than 2 days in a row they couldn't find the bill that we heaved payed the entire stay including the breakfast in advance, when they discovered they didn't apologize. On night stayed there they informed us that the power and the water will shout down until 6 o'clock in the morning, kind of strange...with the safe and everything being without power...but we were ok. I would recommed this hotel for it's great location; closed to everything and it's spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: Gib1971
Reviews.Content: The public areas are nice and rooms acceptable. The location is its best selling point and I cant really complain about anything except the stupidly designed parking access. A small but annoying challenge for my driving abilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel - does the trick”
Reviews.Author: KateLondon_9
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Novotel Les Halles at midday but the staff were kind enough to let us check in then even though check-in normally doesn't start until 3pm. The rooms were big but without character - but that was fine as we wanted a clean base from which to explore Paris, and this is is exactly what we got. The breakfasts were amazing - excellent range of hot and cold food. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was great, right by a metro station and in easy walking distance of the Louvre and Notre Dame. I would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to others who are looking to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, spacious rooms, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: marzillk
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Novotel Les Halles for five nights. We picked the Novotel Les Halles for its great location next to Forum Des Halles, extremely handy for Chatelet metro and RER station. The room was clean, spacious (VERY spacious for central Paris!) and comfortable, with nice touches like the Nespresso machine and complimentary slippers and robes. We had chosen a Deluxe room, which had a separate bathroom and loo (although with no sink in the loo, you still have to go into the bathroom to wash your hands!). The bathroom has a shower stall and a separate bath - it was nice to have the option of both. The room had a good size double bed and two sofas which could both be made up into sofa-beds, so there was plenty of room! I slept on the sofa-bed and it was reasonably comfortable, although I think my sister got the better deal with the double bed! We had lovely views across Forum Des Halles to the Eglise St Eustache. Contrary to what previous reviews have said, wifi is free in the rooms after the first day - you just need to register again each day to access it. We were given a room on a smoking floor, but the room had no smell of smoke at all and it was only occasionally in the corridor that there was a smell of smoke, so we didn't feel the need to move. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, giving us a map to the nearest boulangerie (we'd chosen a room rate which didn't include breakfast), calling us a taxi when we requested it, and bringing up room service food very promptly. We couldn't have asked for better service. Although I speak reasonable French and tried to use my French wherever possible, the staff all spoke good English. The hotel lobby and bar are what you would expect from a four-star hotel and are plushly appointed (I am amazed that a previous reviewer saw mice in the restaurant as the hotel was incredibly clean). The only downside to the Novotel Les Halles is the price, but this is largely due to the terrible pound/euro exchange rate. I would highly recommend this hotel for people looking for a comfortable, excellently located hotel in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Mice...”
Reviews.Author: richie_bingham
Reviews.Content: When in Paris on business I normally stay in the Novotel Paris La Defence - which I really ought to review as I have never had a bad stay there. Unfortunately this time La Defence was booked up so I stayed in the Novotel Paris Les Halles. This hotel is pricy for what you get - but that comes from being in the tourist centre of Paris. The rooms are fine - standard Novotel rooms. The hotel is surrounded by bars and restaurants but I chose to eat in as I wanted a quick meal. Unfortunately there were mice running around the floor of the restaurant and the waiters seemed more concerned with the fact that I was planning to walk out without paying (because of the mice) rather than the mice themselves (which seemed to be a more fundamental problem to me!)

Reviews.Title: “Reliably good, clean hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: VangrooverKits
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable and modern hotel in a central location. Very comfortable rooms with lovely bathroom facilities, including a huge bath and a separate room for the toilet. The best breakfast buffet we ever had made this excellent value for the money. Front desk was very helpful and accommodating, despite some confusion with our reservation. Downside: you only get thin and tiny towels and free wi fi is only in the lobby (paid in your room). Request quiet, non-smoking rooms as there is some noise from the front of the hotel late at night and the smoking floors smell terrible. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Barely 3 star hotel-not worth money”
Reviews.Author: tu-quoque
Reviews.Content: For the period of our stay, booking with expedia.com the price was over 200 euros and this hotel is not worthy of that. The hotel is located next to a metro stop and a short walk to the Seine. Unfortunately, the area around the hotel always smelled of urine. Sadly, it was far from what I was expecting. The hotel, good looking on the outside, is quite old and needs refurbishment. The lobby was comfortable while using the free wi-fi. But the sofas were old and stained . We stayed in Rome and Venice in 4 star hotels paying less and Italian rooms were much bigger and stylish ( see my pics) . Fortunately the staff was friendly and the breakfast was great ( was included in our price.) But I wouldn't go back to this hotel. It’s barely 3 star hotel ( compared to the Italian ones ) and it’s too expensive .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a great location with friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Moojie
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The view from my room was so "Parisian". The room was very spacious and clean. The bed was a bit hard but that can be fixed by the beautiful french wine! The breakfast was by far the best I had in Europe. The hotel is a very short walk to the Louvre and a 4.7km walk to the Eiffel Tower. There are plenty of retaurants in the area and shopping in Les Halles in teriffic. Would definately stay here again - I loved this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: towelobsessive
