Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews about this hotel I was a bit apprehensive. This was a 5 night break for myself, husband and two sons aged 17 and 14, booked through Expedia. We flew from Southampton with Air France to Orly Airport. We got the Orlyval to Anthony and then the RER B to Les Halles, this was all very easy, even though we hadn't done it before. Took us a little while to find the hotel, in the pouring rain, but eventually found it, actually not far from the station. First impressions were good and the reception greeting was polite and friendly, the staff speaking fluent English. We had a family room, which had a King size and two single beds, bathroom and separate toilet, LCD TV, mini bar and tea, coffee making facilities. The room was quite small for all four of us, but we expected this for the price we paid. As others have stated the location is excellent and we walked everywhere. Pompidou Centre is very close, as is the Louvre. Les Halles Shopping Centre was very good and literally outside the back door. We walked along the banks of the Seine and also to the Eiffel Tower. The latter was a long walk which took about 45 to 60 minutes, but enjoyable if you like walking. We also walked to the Arc de Triomphe. Breakfast at the Novotel was very good, if chaotic. A choice of pastries, fruit, cereals, cheese, cold meats and cooked food was available. It was buffet style and so there was a lot of walking up and down and backwards and forwards,trying to dodge people with hot drinks or ending up with egg on your face, but nonetheless quite a good choice I thought. Rooms were kept clean and well stocked each day and the cleaning staff helpful and polite. The correct number of towels were left each day for all 4 of us. This is one of my behmarks of a good hotel, very often not reached! The bar was very pleasant to sit in in the evenings, expensive of course, but the bar staff were always very friendly and helpful. We did eat in the bar a couple of times and enjoyed club sandwiches with fries and salad for just under 15 euros each. There was a pianist in the bar some evenings which was quite enjoyable, just background music. Around the hotel there were many restaurants and cafes we tried a couple but weren't overly impressed, there is also and MacDonalds and KFC is you're desparate, There was tourist info help in the hotel, which was very good and I found all the staff very polite and helpful. This is a city, chain hotel, so you pretty much know what you'll get. It isn't a unique French Hotel, but for me it was of a good standard, ideal for families. The area around the hotel did have quite a heavy Police presence in the evenings, although we didn't see any bad incidences and weren't out late. I also found the Hotel very quiet and wasn't aware of any late night disturbances. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brazil_Fan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel in July 2010 for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay there. Our room was initially not big enough for 2 adults and 2 kids which was my fault for not booking the right size. But the front desk was able to accommodate us and move us into a 'family room" with a pull-out couch for the 2 kids. Hotel rooms are basic but comfortable. The location is great - very central to many things in Paris and close to the Metro station. Overall enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Good value for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you have kids -rooms are basic - location convenient”
Reviews.Author: PeterNandFamily
Reviews.Content: Some rooms have 2 single beds and a double so it is good if you have 2 kids. The breakfast is included and is a reasonable quality. It is right next to the metro at Les halles but is further from the Louvre than you expect. The service is good - a real family hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, lack of welcome”
Reviews.Author: Baba898
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights with children. Location is very good, right in the heart of Paris. Rooms are small with no iron:-) Breakfast is good but you have drag the whole family at once otherwise no breakfast. Staff does not speak English, we felt that communication in English is not welcomed. We wonder why French claim France is a tourist loving country, we felt the other way. We bought tickets for open top bus tour but July 14 was national holiday and there was no service, the ticket master did not inform us, we could not ask anyone for refund, just be careful. The tour bus brochure said that they are open all year around, May be they need a translator. One important tip not related to hotel, cleanliness is not part of Paris culture, we have travel around but Paris is probably the direst city we have visited so far. Interesting haan. I hope this review will be helpful for those travelling with children, need to know French otherwise good luck to you

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMcGuires
Reviews.Content: We'd booked our family into two rooms and when we arrived the hotel had us on different floors. It took about 15mins and we were passed around between 3 different staff members before we had our rooms sorted out on the one floor. After the poor start, everything else went okay, though nothing stands out as special. While the rooms were not big, they were functional and the beds were comfortable. One good thing in this hotel is the foldout lounge suitable for two children, a rarity in Paris. Though average, there was a huge range of food for breakfast. The lobby was comfortable while using the free wi-fi. The hotel is conveniently located next to a metro stop, shops, the Louvre and a short walk to the Seine. Unfortunately, the area around the hotel often smelled of urine.

Reviews.Title: “Not what the pictures showed me!”
Reviews.Author: enriquep100
Reviews.Content: I booked this room based on the photos and the reviews I saw. Sadly, it was far from what I was expecting. The hotel, nice looking on the outside, is quite old and needs refurbishment. The rooms were not comfortable, as the beds were hard, and the blankets harsh. The bathroom was OK. The TV, small. Very small... The lightning in the room, too dimmed. The elevators, really old. I wouldn't go back to this hotel, although the location is SUPERB.

Reviews.Title: “fab location for walking Paris”
Reviews.Author: Penndoll
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a long w/e with mum here; great location for walking to river, the Louvre, Tuileries, Orangerie, Musee D'Orsay, Cluny Museum etc. Great room with double bed and also comfy sofabed so fine to share w friends. Good tea/coffee facilities in room and sep loo/bathroom which was good. Agree breakfasts great selection-wise, just mind the time you go down to eat, esp if in more than party of 2; as we were only 2 we were brought forward and seated in front of groups/families of 4 in front of us due to busy tables, but once you're seated - fab. Didn't eat dinner there as lots of fab restaruants around, esp north thruogh the square and up past the church - see restaruatn review for Saint Etienne bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast. Slow lifts.”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for work. Took the RER from Gare du Nord, and the stop is very convenient for the hotel. (Would have been better if all the escalators were working in the station.) Area a bit sketchy at night...lots of teens just hanging around. Later, one of my French colleagues referred to our hotel as the "Novohell." Hah hah. So--we had free wireless through a deal with my company so I'm not sure if you would normally get that. The breakfast was great and was included in our price. Very extensive buffet. I ended up with a smoking room which I was not happy about, but welcome to France. Front desk did try to change my room but it just wasn't worth the hassle. Varying levels of English at the front desk as during the whole exchange about the smoking, it wasn't really clear whether they were just going to move me while I wasn't around. Lifts were pretty slow. It's a big hotel so at rush hours (mornings and evenings) there was always a wait. At one point, they broke down completely and I had to trek the 4 floors by stairs down and then up again at breakfast time. Nice bar and bar staff. But one evening, THEY RAN OUT OF BEER. Yes, I'm serious. So some of the members of our group went up to their minibars and brought down their own beer. :) Ah, and my shower drain was very very very slow. In short, I think you can do better. The rooms are bigger here than at the K&K, but I like the K&K much better!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location, little expensive”
Reviews.Author: kmac22
Reviews.Content: we came her to go to disneyland paris with my son and i took my mother. the room had a spare sofa bed and to be honest was tiny for three people, but it is the centre of paris so cant complain about size. the hotel was great really centrally located a five min walk to the louvre. we didnt have breakfast so cant review, there was a kids room downstairs by the lobby with a tv some lego and a xbox great for filling in some time. all in all the hotel was clean and smart the lobby was beautiful but hallways upstairs were still needing refurbished! we got a online rate but it was still rather expensive i have been to paris several times and staying in this area as its easy to access all areas of paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, amenities, and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sami7795
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. For me one of its winning features is its practical location right outside Chatelet Les Halles Station. A 30 min RER train ride from Charles de Gaulle Airport will take you directly in front of this hotel. Our room was a corner room and as a result, very spacious, unlike most European hotels. The breakfast was generous but those who desire fresh fruit and juices will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “beware of thieves inside the hotel”
Reviews.Author: quatrefilles1
Reviews.Content: We were pleased, when visiting Paris with our four girls, to find that our hotel (Novotel les Halles) was so centrally located. The huge Chatelet Metro station was right behind the hotel, and the area was very attractive with many coffee shops, restaurants and street vendors. But visitors should beware of possible thieves. Our trip was nearly ruined when my pursed filled with cash, my beloved Ipad, and phone was stolen right under our noses from our room while I was having a nap no less. We found little sympathy from the hotel, and if it weren't for one staff member who directed us to the Police station to file a report we were ready to just leave the whole establishment. Thankfully the police station (ironicly) is also right behind the hotel and only a few minutes walk away. As expected the police confirmed that they have around four or more cases of robbery from the same hotel, and they suspect a staff member(s) to be involved. So travelers the hotel isn't so bad (their breakfast is horible though!) but keep your eyes open and don't leave ANYTHING behind in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Acceptable Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveler43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a "superior suite" on the 4th floor. This hotel is in an outstanding location, is fairly quiet, and has a courteous and professional staff. The rooms are quite clean and modern but not very attractive (somewhat "industrial" feeling). With the suite, it was nice to have a separate tub/shower/toilet room and the extra room to spread out (separate living room with couches), although the layout was chopped up, and the closet storage was awkward. A few minor annoyances for us were: 1) hot water in the shower wasn't nearly hot enough, although the tub hot water was; 2) only a table top (not full size) size ironing board was provided (delivered promptly upon request) but wasn't allowed to stay in the room; 3) elevators are small and crowded during busy times. We had no problems with street or hotel noise, though we could hear coughing and talking through the walls between the bed and the next room and occasionally tv noises from either above or below. We were a middle aged couple traveling alone and did notice a number of families with children but never experienced any disturbances. We never ate in the hotel, given the numerous dining choices nearby. Access to the metro is just steps from the hotel, but ask the hotel for directions on which exit to to take when departing this metro stop. We typically prefer more luxurious accommodations but selected this hotel for its location and affordability of a "suite" type room. Given that both met our expectations we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, comfortable hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: SThakkar
Reviews.Content: This was a perfectly located hotel for our family, right in the middle of Paris in the Les Halles, Chatelet area. Check-in was smooth, and the rooms were comfortable. Clean bathrooms, shower and bath-tub. It was a little small for a family with 2 kids, but still comfortable. Public transportation was just below the hotel. Metro, RER and cabs. The Louvre and Pompidou were a 10 minute walk away. There were fantastic cafes, restaurants and McDee's around the hotel. There is a huge mall directly behind the hotel, a mere 50 meters away from the rear entrance An excellent stay. Waiting to go back

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: ohioglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no character - room was drab with stained carpets and the hallway carpet looked very dirty. The breakfast was average and the location lacked any French charm. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SoulQuince
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. There are so many bars, restaurants, shops and landmarks within a short walking distance. It was a great base and we would stay there again. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room had a balcony and view overlooking the square. The room was large and had a comfy bed, t.v and fridge. Nice decor, good bathroom with power shower, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: muffinman11
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel early and thought we wouldnt be able to check in for hours but they said we could check in straight away and gave us room with brilliant view. over looked lovely church and the forum les halles shopping centre. Hotel is so clean, big and nice and staff all friendly and helpful. great location near to a nice square with fountain and lots of restaurants. within walking distance of the louvre and notre dame. metro just outside door of hotel so anywhere else is easily accessible. Only problem for some people might be a bit of noise at night due to the closeness of bars and noisy teenagers drunk outside at 6 in the morning. Also breakfast cost of 17 euro each is way to dear so we only ate there once. would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the main selling point”
Reviews.Author: nikeexplore
Reviews.Content: Not too bad but not brilliant either at the price. Good breakfast but stingy with room supplies, had to make special request for shower cap! Clean room but old looking carpet. I would not really choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: pinkgisa
Reviews.Content: Novotel Paris Les Halles is really good. The location is great, near Les Halles (a huge comercial center), Saint Eustache Church (nice church where I went to a concert), lots of metro stations, lots of french restaurants and fast foods (Pizza Hut, Mc Donald´s, Quick), lots of stores, pharmacies etc. It´s near Rivoli street too, a famous parisien street. If u follow this street (20, 30 minutes walking) you get to Louvre Museum. The metro station near the hotel (Chatelet) is very good because there are a lot of other lines that pass through this station. The breakfast is really nice, there are breads, yogurts, fruits, croissants, juice, coffee, chocolate, pancakes, eggs, bacon, french fries (!!!). I don´t eat that much in the breakast, but it was good value. The rooms are nice, clean, with cable TV and there is room service. Very quiet. Exception: as soon as you get to the hotel you can see that there are some warnings about some constructions they are doing over there. In my room, in the first day, I could hear some noise, but it wasn´t loud at all. And they don´t do that during the night and the early morning. The staff is nice, friendly, and there´s a touristic information office in the hotel. There are 2 Apple computers with free internet. There´s also a luggage room, if you need to put your luggage and wait to go to the airport or if you get there before check-in time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: berges
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend break and thought the hotel was great. We had booked well in advance so got a good deal through the hotel's website for a superior room with breakfast. Check in was quick and our room was large and clean. Breakfast was a good variety of hot food, pastries etc (good cappuccino from the machine!) - we didn't have to wait as there were only the two of us but we did see larger groups waiting for about 10 mins to be seated. The bar area was wonderfully relaxing - live pianist. The hotel is within walking distance of the Louvre and Notre Dame. Only negative for us was that we found the Chatelet les Halles rail station a bit of a nightmare to get out of even though there was an exit by the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but ....”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over weekends as part of the eurostar packages. Location of hotel is unbeatable but you pay for it so there isnt much to celebrate. We paid for an executive room but was given a room in a floor where renovations were on going, ceiling stripped down in the corridor. Went down and complain and were given a larger than standard executive room (one of those larger rooms in odd corner). I always got a feeling that hotel dont like fly & stay or Travel & stay deals, they always treat customer on these deals as a pest, giving worst rooms imaginable, thats the reason why we booked an executive room. Front desk is slow and often they end up explaining to guest where to go, what sights to see which I believe it is the job of the concierge. Breakfast is good but after 9am the wait can be 20 minuts or longer but staff here is very efficient and friendly. TV channels mostly non english, I remember there is only 2 or 3 english channels, can be boring for kids who wants their usual cartoon channels. The kids pull out beds are comfortable no complain. The entrance to metro vide les halles is closed on sunday, the entrance right in front of the hotel requires you to have a prepaid tickets or carnet in hand.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonSummerGirl
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is in a great location. Lots of shopping and dining nearby, and walking distance to the Louvre and other attractions. The property is clean, beds were comfortable, and staff was helpful. The hotel is currently undergoing renovations, so it is bit noisy during the day. Overall, we had a good experience, but I would not rate this property as a 4-star by American standards. Small rooms, thin towels and lack of other creature comforts make me rate this hotel as more of a 3-star. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this is not the place for you. If location is your deciding factor, however, this hotel is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DrSavant
Reviews.Content: VERY conveniently located, however I usually expect more from a Novotel (Dusseldorf is a stellar example of a good Novotel). This being said, for Paris, this is decent, if not as clean as I would like. Despite having our windows face a fairly busy area, the sound proofing is excellent - the room was very quiet. Front desk staff are only semi helpful (claimed there is no printer access for the computers in the lounge, when there is a working printer right there!). All in all, it was a pleasant stay - I would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: venvit
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, everything you need is there! very well located (city center) and very well connected through subway.big rooms medium-high price. underground paying parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location some reception staff let it down”
Reviews.Author: SurreyDotty
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location with direct RER access from CDG to hotel door. Nice lobby area for relaxing with a bar and piano area. Rooms were very clean with clean sheets clean bathrooms. Breakfast was included in the rate and was very nice with lots of choice and a lovely view of the church outside. The male receptionist that checked us out was really efficient and polite he helped us store our bags so we could sight see on our last day. As we had 2 teenagers with us we had Macdonalds and pizza hut on our doorstep which was great as prices are high in the restaurants. The restaurant staff were excellent really busy clearing away and keeping breakfast stocked up. Cons: We arrived at 1pm and asked for a room away from the building works that we had heard about on trip advisor - not sure if thnis annoyed her but she then said the room wasnt ready (check-in is from12) she suggested we go and buy lunch in the restaurant and wait. When we questioned what time the room would be ready she said she didnt know? As we were keen to change our clothes and sight see we were disappointed. She told us they would look after our bags and suggested we speak to themanager - we agreed that we would speak to the manager and suddenly she had a room ready! however perhaps it was her little joke but it was an inside room with a window that didnt open and was about 90 degrees - we assumed it would cool down later and went out - but that night I had visions of us all flaking out in the room there was no way we could sleep so at 10.30pm went down to reception - I am sure the girl knew exactly what the problem was because she gave us another room immediately without question - but no apology whatsoever or offer to help us move - so we moved all of our gear up to the next floor and this room was much better. Front reception staff need customer service training (not the male who checked us out) but some of the women really let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a decidedly average hotel”
Reviews.Author: whicuz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline, and although I was extremely pleased that it was within walking distance of the Louvre and Paris island, I was not impressed with the hotel at all. It had no facilities other than the rather modern lounge downstairs, and although the lobby was very clean and new, it had very little character. The room I had, while also very clean, was definitely average. It was very basic, and looked like it hadn't been renovated (other than to update the furniture) since the mid-nineties. It was perfectly acceptable for a weekend stay and was a decent deal, but I would not expect anything special, and it is certainly not a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great first time in Paris started at Novotel Paris Les Halles”
Reviews.Author: time2getaway
Reviews.Content: I had an incredible stay (albeit with a few snags to start). Getting the snags out of the way: when I first checked in, I was given a smoking room rather than the non-smoking room I'd reserved. It was so late and I was so exhausted, I was too tired to switch until morning. It was also very hot in the room, a problem that could not be fixed even by the maintenance staff. The next day, though, the staff was *very* helpful in getting me into a non-smoking room. The rooms were great, modern, and spacious. The staff was very gracious and full of helpful information on places to go, timing for flights, etc. In a feat that truly amazed me, the concierge was able to get me same-day train tickets to visit a close friend in Flavigny, even though I'd been told that the trip was impossible because an advance ticket purchase was required. This alone still makes me want to give a "Five-Star" review, but I am trying to be objective for prospective guests. Overall, I though the location was great in terms of being close to both RER, Metro, and simply walking to several sights--the Louvre is blocks away, for example. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr._Bob_4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right near the RER and Metro yet also within waling distance or many of Paris's famous attractions as well as many great restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We particularly appreciated their allowing us to occupy our room early after our long fight from the US. The bar was great, providing us with a good quality wine every night. Breakfast was quite good, with a large variety of healthy choices. Our room was spacious and clean, with a nice view of a quiet square. The only minor complaint is that we did not get the free internet service mentioned in some of the reviews. The internet was fairly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Smart choice”
Reviews.Author: Aburel
Reviews.Content: Location is great, few minutes away from Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou, Rue de Rivoli, Louvre, aso. Classic Novotel, good services, nice staff. Breakfast is having good pastry and nice coffee as an example. In the neighborhood plenty of restaurants and cafes where to have a perfect dinner. Good price for Paris, nice quality price ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: ddctravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Les Halles for 5 nights. We were really impressed by it's fabulous location. The metro station and RER entry is right at the entry of the hotel. Fabulous location for restaurants, shopping and many of Paris' tourist attractions. We were able to walk to the Lourve (10 mins) and Notra Dame. The Effiel tower was only a 10 min bus ride. We also took the train to Disneyland which was a direct train only taking 30 mins. As I was travelling with young children aged 5 and 2, location was important and the Novotel Les Halles didn't let us down. The rooms are well equipped for families. They have a pull out sofabed for the kids and was fairly comfortable. When we first checked in we were given a smaller room where we could hardly move with our luggage. I called the front desk and asked if there was a larger room as we felt cramped. They happily searched and relocated us to another room which was still the same room type but much larger. It pays to ask. The free internet service was great. We had our laptop so could log in daily free of charge. The buffet breakfast each morning was also goodt, but just be aware that it becomes very busy an at times we were made to queue up and wait for a table, some mornings up to 15 minutes. There is a small play area in the lobby where children could han out and play. My children loved going there each morning after breakfast and meeting other children from all over the world. The staff on the front desk are helpful and can all speak English well. We had no difficulties with communicating and getting directions. I would definitely stay at this hotel again as it's location was just fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Bloodman33
Reviews.Content: At $225/night for a "superior queen" I worried what we might find. It was a great location (to sights, metro, restaurants, night life, Left Bank, Louvre, Notre Dame), clean, nice rooms, OK service, good AC, comfy bed, could even see Eiffel from the room! Novotels are mid-level Accor (Sofitel) hotels and they do a good job at bringing good value. No frills, but you get what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, purposeful but no charm”
Reviews.Author: Goldkueste
Reviews.Content: We chose the Novotel as it is the only chain that accomodates two children in the same room as the parents, avoiding the hassle and price of two separate rooms. Location is great, the hotel is close to almost everything and extremely easy to get to from Charles de Gaulle, the RER stop is 50 metres away. Rooms are purposeful and clean but one wonders how the 4-star rating came about, except for the flat screen and the hairdryer. Common areas are nice with a live music bar but the breakfast is an ordeal you could do without; if you come after 9, be prepared to wait for 15-20 mins to get a table, not because there are too few but simply because the staff dont' manage to organize themselves in any efficient way to seat people quickly. The quality of the breakfast itself is however clearly above the Paris mean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View And High Price”
Reviews.Author: santarita004
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after finding my first hotel to be shabby and noisy. This hotel was great in comparison. The room was at the end of the hall so it was quiet. Everything (tv, shower, etc.) worked well and I was able to sleep well, even though I am a light sleeper. My room overlooked the gardens and I had a great view of St. Eustache, which is an amazing structure. The location is central with many bistros and cafes within easy walking distance. I was offered breakfast at 21 euros but with cafes and patisseries nearby, why eat at the hotel? The staff was efficient even if a bit cold. I booked at the last minute and was able to get only the rack rate. Knock about &5 euros off the daily rate and I'd give the hotel a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacatin in wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bdezra
Reviews.Content: When we invited the room we told that we will come with our daughter and she is 19 and we got a big room. The room was very comfertale. The breakfast was very good and all the stuff was very kind and spoke with us english. We were very very satisfied from the hotel and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good "No Frills" hotel in very central location”
Reviews.Author: boliston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked mainly because I have been happy with Novotels in the past an the location just can't be beaten for centrality. The Chatelet metro is right outside the front door of the hotel and this was very handy to get from the Eurostar terminal at Gard du Nord. The building is modern and I prefer this as "old" hotels whist having "character" will sometimes have annoyances like odd room layouts, creaky floorboards and strange plumbing. I asked for an "outside" room as I did not want to just look out onto the courtyard and I was given a room on the 4th floor where I could see Montmartre Basilica if I stuck my head out of the window. The area round the Hotel is mainly pedestrianised so there is very little traffic noise and you get the sound of people mainly. I left my window wide open at night as I hate dry air con air and I like to hear some sound outside to remind me that I'm in a city! The rooms were pretty much like any other Novotel but the WC was separate to the bathroom. The shower was good with a decent pressure. The buffet breakfast was pretty good but one day they ran out of bacon and did not bother restocking with more bacon even after I told them we had run out. At least they did not run out of croissants! The coffee was pretty good as a need a decent cup of black coffee to get me started. One annoyance was that the door of the next room to mine had very squeaky hinges and I told reception that it needed oiling but I don't think they understood what I was saying. I did not eat any meals there apart from the breakfast (included in my room rate which I booked with Novotel's website) as there are so many good & cheap cafes & bistros nearby and Hotel restaurants are invariably overpriced anyway.

Reviews.Title: “No Longer Nice”
Reviews.Author: Sheherezade
Reviews.Content: This used to be great value in central Paris, but it's become very rundown. We had to move to another room because of no hot water at all, the second room had a shower that leaked from ground level all over the floor - I'm talking a deluge here, not a trickle! And when we stayed again (having already booked and paid) on return leg of this journey, we had another bathroom that flooded badly. The rooms were shabby, with stained carpets, old, frayed blankets and sagging beds. The whole place looks sadly past its sell by date. The staff were friendly and helpful but there's nothing they can do about the fact that the place in falling apart. It wasn't built to last, and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good service. Great view.”
Reviews.Author: NRighton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location was amazing. Very easy access to / from the Metro. Walking distance to all of historic central Paris. The front desk was very helpful and polite. Free public internet computers were available in the lobby as well. The room was clean and comfortable. I had called a month in advance and requested a room with a view and was very pleased with the room we received. Below is a picture out the window of the room The hotel also has rooms with a courtyard view if you prefer less street noise (although we had very little due to double paned windows) but the view is aweful. If you stay here Be sure to walk over to Boulangerie Julien (75 rue St. Honoré) and get some of Paris' best tarts and coffe. I was skeptical about a stay in a large hotel chain feeling I would miss out on the quintesential Parisian experience but was very satisfied with our stay. I would stay at the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: OhioRon
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy that we chose Novotel Paris Les Halles. The lobby and service areas are quite nice, and free internet is provided with free workstations in the lobby and, I'm told, free WiFi elsewhere (but I can't confirm WiFi). The room is very nice. They told me that every room has a queen bed with a sofa and can become a double bed. There is a minibar in the room that can also be used for keeping your own food and drinks cold. The hotel is air conditioned, but we didn't try that in the room because it was fairly comfortable keeping the window open. I truly loved the location. It's an easy walk to the Louvre, Orsay, Notre Dame and, especially, the Pompidou center. We could see the Eifel Tower clearly from our bedroom window. Within 3-4 blocks from our hotel are all kinds of neat restaurants (French, Italian, Turkish, Indian, Asian, Egyptian, etc.), I didn't try all of these, but I tried! The front desk was quite accommodating. When I had a problem with an air reservation, I went to the desk to ask for the phone number of Air France. Instead of that, they phoned the airlines themselves and solved my problem for me. All of the above is positive; here's the other side. The hotel, while quite nice, is on a small cul-de-sac. We had a group of nine people and used three taxis to get to the hotel. Two of the three taxi drivers had trouble finding it. Even the GPS system in the taxi I used seemed to give inaccurate instructions. Also, there are some loud young people in front of the hotel at night and I think some in my group were worried by them. I never found them to be a problem and felt OK walking around by myself. Overall, this was a great place to stay. If I return to Paris again, I will seriously consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Les Halle is perfectely located for a citytrip in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: RosalindaBelgium
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the cnetre of the city, across the metro station. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with Airconditioning in the summer. The staff is friendly and helpfull, breakfast is well orgnaised and elaborate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, typical budget hotel in Paris but rather pricey”
Reviews.Author: escog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 4 nights on a business trip. The location is fantastic - only minutes away from the Chatelet Les Halles metro stop and RER station. Also, near some good brasseries and not far from Notre Dame. The hotel itself is a typical 4-star in Europe - what would be considered a 3-star in the US. The rooms are small, which is typical for Paris, but functional and comfortable enough. I had a queen sized bed, sofa, tv, and ensuite bathroom. It had the usual amenities - e.g. iron, hair dryer, mini-bar, coffee-making things, etc. The tv only had 1 English-language station - BBC. I was on the first floor (second floor in the US), and I could hear street noise, but not enough to bother me. There's free wi-fi in the lobby and a couple of Mac's for web browsing. The rate I had included free breakfast and one other meal free, so it made the rate more justifiable. I still found it a bit pricey, even for Paris. The breakfast buffet was good, but a bit uneven. The pastries (croissants and pain du chocolat) were excellent, but that's what you expect in Paris. The scrambled eggs were a bit runny, but the bacon and sausage were good. The rest was fine. The wait staff was attentive and helpful, and most spoke English, as did the check-in staff. It was a good stay, but adjust your expectations. You're definitely paying for the location, which is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: RodosMarathonTravel
Reviews.Content: After looking for weeks in the internet finally I picked this hotel and I did't regret it. Iam a travel agent so I am very picky. This was a nice hotel good rooms very good breakfast and well located. 2 minute walk to the largest metro in Paris. Friendly staff and very clean. Would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: luvs_trvl_and_dogs
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Novotel Les Halles. The hotel is located about a 15 minute walk from both Notre Dame and the Louvre and directly on the RER line coming into the city from CDG, as well as one of the major metro hubs. This makes it a perfect place for basing any trip to Paris as it is incredibly easy to get to all the rest of the sights in the city. The room itself was nice - clean, comfortable, modern. The shower and shower room were quite nice and very chic. The toilet, however, was in a seperate room and desperately needed updating. We got a great price for this hotel off of Priceline. Given the location, it was an excellent choice for seeing Paris over a long weekend. The amount of time actually spent in the room was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel. Will return for sure.”
Reviews.Author: notreadytogo
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline and got this hotel for $130 US per night including taxes and fees, for a 2 night stay (Midweek Tue/Wed). Location is superb, after arriving on eurostar just 1 metro stop down to hotel. 5 mins walk to Halles Metro interchange giving easy to all of Paris. We checked in early at Noon with no problem, staff were friendly helpful and happy to converse in English, we asked about the fridge in the room, and they were happy to send a staff member up to clear the minibar so we could use it to keep our own items cold which was very nice of them, Great view, quality room furishings. Did not eat in the hotel as there were so many outlets nearby and $18 for the Hotel breakfast was just over the top. Tea and coffee facilities in room were welcome. Every time we spoke to staff they were friendly and helpful, there is a good secure baggage room where we left our bags after we checked out till 5pm

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowBlackAdder
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for one night. Couldn't fault it for its central location - 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame and the tour boats and €10 in a taxi to the Eiffel Tower. Rooms clean, reception quick and quiet (perhaps we were just lucky?). We were a family of 4 and shared a room so good value for the location (paid €174 for the night). Our room was on 5th floor and we could see the Eiffel Tower from our window. Room quiet and comfortable. As we were trying to keep the costs down, we didn't eat there but there were loads of places nearby for good breakfast and dinner. We also used the car park below the hotel. Parked about 10 metres from the lift up into the hotel so very handy. Parking cost us €22 for 24 hours. Easier than parking outside Paris and travelling in on metro and probably as cheap. Watch out, though. You need to pay for the parking at the reception to get the reduced rate. The parking pay machine in the hotel lobby charges you more (€37).

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Central Location but let down by service”
Reviews.Author: WandererIndia
Reviews.Content: Was Visiting Paris along with family and booked the hotel due to its central location and closeness to the metros and food outlets.Was not disappointed on both counts as the location is very close to the main metro station and there are lots of food outlets behind the hotel in a large courtyard.The service in the hotel was just about average and the reception was always crowded and they seemed to be poorly trained.Even though we arrived at 2 pm it was almost 4 pm by the time we got the room.Had another bad experience in that I had taken tickets to disneyland from the hotel and the receptionist had given me child tickets for all by mistake .

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: kki
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the reviews on the tripadvisor, I have selected Novotel,Les Halles for our 3 days stay in Paris recently. Honestly, I was a bit worried about the quality and size of the hotel room, before I went to Paris, given that most visitors stress on the low quality and the small size of the hotel rooms in Paris. At Novotel Les Halles, I was pleasantly surprised! We stayed in a superior room with my wife and 7 years old daughter. The room was of moderate size with a confortable queen bed, a couch and and a desk. Pretty modern looking, with all the standard amenities. The room was a bit cold overnight (it was probably around 20-21 Celcius, but we are used to a bit more than this), then next day they have provided a heater immediately, and thereafter we were very confortable. The personnel was very friendly, and helpful. The location is simply excellent. The big metro and RER hub, Chatelet-Les Halles is just accross the hotel, and there are several restaurants in the area. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again, when I go to Paris. I believe it carries all the standard characteristics of a chain hotel, and this is pretty reassuring to me.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bruno.bemelmans
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for 2 nights at the Novotel Les Halles and booked an executive room at the fourth floor. Nice room with a view on the Forum les Halles. Fantastic location near the Centre Pompidou and the metro Chatelet Les Halles. Good and smooth check-in, nice Novotel room (you know what you'll get). Some tips: Take breakfast before 9.00am athorwise quite crowdy. Fabulous restaurants we booked online: Curieux Spaghetti Bar, 14 Rue Saint Merri and Casa Pepe, 5 Rue Mouffetard. A must do in Paris: Centre Pompidou and Musee d'Orsay, also booked the tickets onlne to avoid queing. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Bland and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DPMont
Reviews.Content: I got a good price for this hotel, so I end up disappointed, but not extremely angered. The hotel is certainly well located. But this is not a 4 stars hotel. Plastic glasses in room, cheap linen, cheap bedding, depressing hallways. You are not in any ways staying in a top hotel. I visit Paris regularly and I generally went to three stars hotel which are much more classy, clean, elegant than this anonymous bland hotel. Taking into account that "4 stars" is the top category for hotels in Paris, I wonder how the Novotel Les Halles got 4 stars. At half the price, this would be a good choice, but never a place where you will feel the charm of a real Parisian hotel, the Novotel is an anonymous industrial product.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichGuy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated very centrally in Paris and you can walk (or take the Metro from Chatelet-Les Halles) to anywhere in Paris. Check in was OK but they put me in a smoking room on the 3rd floor overlooking a courtyard. The floor was being refurbished and the workmen were incredibly noisy. I immediately went back to reception and asked for a non-smoking room. The new room was on the 4th floor, with a view out over Les Halles - I could see the Sacre Couer from my hotel room! Amazing. Internet access was troublesome as they don't have wi-fi in the rooms (but they do in the lobby). You need an ethernet cable in your room; I had to go out and buy one as the hotel had run out. Breakfast was buffet style - what you would expect from a corporate chain hotel; although the hot food was lacking somewhat in freshness, being almost bone dry! Check-out was painfully slow as I don't think they have enough staff (or desks) to cope with a mass exit. Having said all the above, it does what it says on the tin - a standard corporate chain hotel in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Nozza-22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for a week. The rooms are okay but there are buisness facilities on hand. Check-in desk is way too over-crowded. Breakfast is very-good. So close to the Louvre, the Sienne River and behind is the biggest metro stop in Paris: Chatelet - Les Halles. I would choose this hotel for people who like a good start to the day and will spend a lot of time sightseeing. DO NOT Choose this hotel if you plan to relax in the room and rest a lot. PS. No Pool but there is two computers downstairs for guest use.

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute waste of money....”
Reviews.Author: MC-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Les Halles for 6 nights in September and were absolutely appalled with it. We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the RER/Metro and the ease of getting to/from the airport, and this really is the only thing going for it. We arrived on the train, and the exit that leads directly to the Novotel wasn't open, so we ended up having to walk through the Forum shopping mall, then weaving our way around the outside mall to find it. We found the entrance and were kind of disgusted to see about 9 Novotel employees crowding the doorway having a cigarette. We currently live in China, and absolutely everybody smokes wherever they like so this wasn't much of a surprise, but this type of behaviour from staff didn't really give a good first impression - particularly when we couldn't even manage to get our luggage through the pack of them without an effort. Check in was relatively easy, but we're sure we were re-allocated to the furthest room possible because we booked and pre-paid our accommodation on Expedia. We don't speak any French, however the girl behind was preparing our key, and a colleague of hers spoke to her then said ".......Expedia" and shook his head. She then re-coded the key and we ended up in the very last room of the corridor, in the furthest spot from the lifts. Previous reviews mentioned that 1 of the 3 lifts wasn't operational - this is still the case, so who knows when the Novotel will actually get their act together and fix it. While we didn't have too many problems with waiting for the lift, on the occasions that we did, it was because they were completely full with staff, on their way downstairs for their cigarette break. We live in an apartment in a 5 star hotel, and we have never experienced a time when the staff take priority over the guests when trying to use the lifts - they actually get out of the lift to allow us to use it. We even experienced a time when we arrived at the lift first, then 2 maintenance people arrived with tool belts etc. The lift was quite crowded when it arrived and instead of allowing us in first, the maintenance crew barged their way through and took up the remaining space in the lift. Maybe that's the infamous French attitude..... Our room for the most part was nice enough, decent size with quite a comfortable bed but it was a very strange set up with the toilet right inside the front door, separate to the bathroom. This was convenient for when someone was in the shower, however there was no tap or washing facilities in there, so it was still necessary to interrupt whoever was using the bathroom to be able to wash your hands. The shower also, was absolutely disgusting with mould covering about 60% of it. It was blatantly obvious that the cleaners would stand on the outside of the shower and only clean as high as they could reach. As soon as you looked higher than eye level, the mould was so thick it was completely off-putting. Trying to complain about this was an experience, with housekeeping and reception "playing dumb" and pretending not to understand. The most bizarre thing we found though was that at midnight every night, the television service cut out. Every night at exactly the same time, the satellite connection dropped out. Every night we complained and were told that it was a technical issue that they were trying to deal with. On our last night there, another complaint was made when the tv cut out yet again and this time we were told that we must have been put in one of the "bad rooms", and did we went to be moved to another room. Too little, too late - why would we want to change rooms when we were 8 hours away from checking out? Every request and complaint with this hotel fell on deaf ears - from clean towels (sorry, don't have any), to the ridiculous situation with the tv (obviously they expect everyone to be asleep by midnight and don't pay for a full 24 hour satellite connection). This hotel may have been in a pretty good location, with lots of restaurants and cares nearby, but that certainly doesn't make up for the terrible service and revolting standard of the rooms. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location/Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mario-MC
Reviews.Content: Very good 4 stars Hotel (European Standard) located in the heart of Parisian Les Halles (10 meters from subway exit Chatelet/Les Halles). The Hotel is nice, didnt try the breakfast, rooms are ok and comfortable. Would higlhy recommend it for excellent quality/pric ratio and for perfect center of Paris location.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel was Great!”
Reviews.Author: JJBEMB
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews on this hotel, I could not disagree more with the negative comments. My husband and I just returned from travelling throughout France and Italy. The hotel has recently been renovated in the last couple of years. All rooms in Paris are smaller in size. The staff were very friendly and the location is great. We had the buffet breakast and didn't have any problems with line-ups or crowding. The staff stored our luggage for us and were very accommodating. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive average hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJC17
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it is well known hotel chain. It was our 15th wedding anniversary and wanted something special, and at 480 euros for 2 nights, although quite expensive, thought it would be nice and was willing to pay a little extra as booked a superior room. Got to the hotel and check in was quick and chap on reception spoke good english and was very pleasant. Got to room but was disappointed - it was a basic room with a double bed and settee that presumably converted into a bed. Decor was very bland and bathroom nothing special. Although room was clean, disappointed that room appeared no more than a family room. Enquired at reception (to a different member of staff) about whether room was family room or superior room, advised that it was a family room and that no superior rooms available that night (arrived in Paris at hotel at 9pm). Advised to come back the next morning and he would try and arrange another room. Called back to reception after breakfast and had to tell the story to yet another member of staff - advised to come back later, after 3pm to change room. This member of staff advised that room was a superior room - certainly didn't appear to be superior room. Got back to hotel later in afternoon after sightseeing and was greeted by yet another member of staff - explained situation again and was advised of different room. Went to room on 5th floor - slightly different with separate bath and shower and view over gardens - quite pleasant. If you need an iron I would recommend to take your own travel iron - I had went down to reception to see if an iron was available advised that she would get housekeeping to come to room with one. No-one appeared within half hour so phoned again - think they had forgotten - the receptionist phoned back to advise that no irons available and that housekeeping would come to room when one was available. No-one appeared from housekeeping. All in all hotel was very average and quite expensive for "basic" hotel with no "extras". Rooms are not to the same standard as reception area, bar area and toilets located near bar. This sadly lets the hotel down as could be a really great hotel. Allbeit hotel situated in centre of Paris - this is obviously why hotel so expensive. Very good location, with metro station (Chatelet) right outside hotel (make sure you check what street you are exiting on when leaving metro station when returning to hotel - several exits). Nice relaxing bar - although very expensive (as is the rest of Paris). Plenty of bars/cafes in area to eat out or sit and have a coffee or glass of wine. I would rate this hotel as 3 stars and definately not 4.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend City-break”
Reviews.Author: geoff1007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for 3 nights (wedding anniversary), reception staff really helpful. I asked for a "nice" room and the lady behind the desk did a room search and advised me that she had no good rooms available, but if I came back in an hour she would have reserved one for me. Sure enough, on our return (after a long cool drink in a nearby pavement cafe, we were given a large room overlooking the Forum Les Halles gardens, super service. I have seen some comments regarding the number of young adults who make this place a little uncomfortable at night. My wife and I (both in our 60's) had no issues at all (there were a couple of night-sleeper vagrants, but caused to problems at all). The surrounding area is brilliant for dining out or just having a drink. The usual mix of up-market restaurants, pub meals and fast-food outlets. All this and only 10 mins walk form the Seine and the best museum in the world, the Louvre. Go and take a look at the glass pyramid. We visited two of the Irish bars and were made most welcome. A meal and a Guinness is just right after a day sightseeing. We had our anniversary on the dining cruise of the Bateaux Parisienne, quite expensive at around £120 per person, buy what a meal!! For a special occasion it can't be beaten, all the food, together with wine/cocktails/aperitif + the night views of Paris. Two minor bad points with the hotel- one of the lifts was out of action all weekend which made it a queue sometimes. The other item was the breakfast , we had a deal whereby this was included in the price of the room, but if I had paid the 17 euro per person I would have been very disappointed. Take my advice, don't pay the money, it isn't worth it as there are plenty of bars within 100 meters who will do you a propoer "full English" for half the cost. As I have been a regular visitor to Paris, take this tip, buy a Metro Pass for the number of days you intend to be in Paris - great value at around 6 euros per day. I paid 36 euros for two people for zones 1,2 & 3. It allows you unlimited travel on the metro and the RER (up-market metro, used for the out-of-town journeys, similar to the S-Bann trains in Germany). Hotel parking is underground and pricey at 22 euors per day, but then this is central Paris

Reviews.Title: “great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: monkeyherder
Reviews.Content: Normally, we stay in the 7th arrondissement to be close to Rue Cler and the Tour Eiffel, but this time we brought the kids so that was cost-prohibitive. This is a nice chain hotel that is reasonably priced. It is very family friendly and kids eat breakfast free, though it's still overpriced even just paying for 2 adults, so we opted for the nearby McDonalds (the kids!). The rooms are clean and adequate in size and the bathrooms are very modern - I will never understand what the deal is with no shower curtains in Europe - but the shower/bathtub itself was actually quite big as well. There is really no decor to speak of, but we did have a nice view of Les Halles, overlooking a great kid's park, a carousel and beautiful church. You are close to the metro and have a couple different options for stops, Chatelet being the best one so you don't have to go through the mall to get in and out. There are many restuarants around (besides the mall) but it's just a short walk to Notre Dame and many many more options. In the evenings there are lots of teens and young adults hanging out in big groups around the area so people not used to teens and/or youth who might be classified as "thugs" might feel intimidated. Overall it was a good experience staying in this hotel and I would recommend it to familes or anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: travelboy2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in November 2007 for a conference. The hotel is a good four-star hotel, although I had no time to check the gym or any of the facilities. But the room is spacious, clean and modern with a nice bath and all amenities you would expect from a hotel of this category. Breakfast is in a large hall, illuminated by very cool blue lighting, although it does make it quite dark - but if you don't want to read the paper at breakfast, it's fine. The best part of the hotel though was the location with a direct access to the Les Halles Metro and within the pedestrian zone around Les Halles, this is a tremendous place to stay. Considering I stayed during a trade fair and only paid 170EUR, the price is well worth what I was offered, considering other hotels I have had to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: Gibso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, walking distance to notre damme with the metro and RER on you doorstep you can get the train from the airport to right to the hotel and a direct train to Disney.I found the rooms to be a good size for Paris ,with a fold out sofa bed for my Daughter were was still enough room.Nice foyer area and reception was helpful and polite.Mini bar quite expensive but i would return a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for everyone”
Reviews.Author: IzzyStevens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in June...the location was fantastic to explore paris and ease to gare de Lyon and even eurodisney as you don't need to switch metro lines or anything. I was with my partner, my two nieces and their two grandmothers so we had two rooms..rooms are small and somewhat dingy (but with great brand-new flat LCD TV's), but along the back they have great views of Les Halles and a wonderful gothic church. I would not call this a four star hotel (see below), although the lobby and lobby bar look very nice. For what we were paying in central paris within walking distance practicalyl of everything I wanted to see, I thought it was excellent value for the money and would stay again. Now for the negatives: 1. The front desk!!! Message to management: HIRE SOME PEOPLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This hotel is gigantic with hundreds of rooms...now guess how many people are usually working at the front desk? Max 3 at any given time, and mostly just two; no manager in sight. It is complete anarchy and unacceptable for a hotel this size...check in takes at least 20 minutes and check out can be even worse depending on the time you choose. There is ALWAYS a line-up...if you want to call it that...people just sort of crowd around the desks as they are oval and nobody really knows how to apparoach that. Some of the staff frankly try their best, but I would imagine that the turnover of the staff is really high as it is so overwhelming that they must throw in the towel after a few months...it is really sad...BE PREPARED FOR THIS. 2. Certain front desk staff: some are angels and are only to happy to call a taxi etc. I had a horrible (and what most would call a typical rude parisian) experience with some poorly-trained estagiare who obviously thought herself above having to work at the front desk of a hotel...after an itialian family decided to make their own line-up along the front desk, I made sure that I was to be next to do my checkout. She told me that they were there first (they arrived 5 minutes after me); I told her that I was in the line long before them and that it wasn't my problem she wasn't looking behind the person she was serving (I mean, if the line up doesn't start behind the person that is currently being served, where is it to start!!??). There was this back and forth, which I find unimagineable that a counter person would engage in(and continue with). She should be fired for behaviour and disrespect like this. Arguing at the front desk of a hotel in front of 10 people?? Shameful. It ruined my whole stay. 3. Breakfast Buffet: be warned! get there early, or get there late! At 9am one morning there was a queue (at least it was being respected!) of probably 40 people and the breakfast room was packed. We ended up eating a wonderfully typical parisian breakfast at a small café in the square beside the hotel out on the terrace in the sunshine, while parisians passed by on their way to work...do this at least once during your vacation, you will love it. While the wait for the buffet can be outrageously long, it is actually a good, well stocked buffet which I enjoyed. Despite the horrible woman at the front desk and the waits to check in or out, I still would stay here again for the convenience and decent price. But please, Novotel, if you read this, PLEASE hire more people for the front desk and it might be time to do a clean-up of your desk staff and a re-training in customer service, as this keeps your hotel from being considered a true 4 star...(read the rest of the reviews)

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: geds35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel Les Halles for 5 nights in June a family of 2 adults and 2 children in one room. While the room was small it was clean and the bathroom recently renovated. The location was great next to les Halles Metro and RER station. It is close to many resturants, cafes and bars. There was plently of Police and transit police security at night, they park their vans at the rear of the hotel. Our family felt safe and we have no concern recommending the hotel. To me the rates are expensive, however having the whole family in one room is the best way to minmise costs.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: DanishRome
Reviews.Content: I always trust TA reviews and chose Novotel Les Halles because I had good rate as an airline employee and most of the other more characteristic hotels were full but were aware of the problems I could have encountered. The hotel is rated as a 4 star but it should belong to a 3 star really, I agree now with many other reviewers. The staff at reception are very helpful and friendly and this is great of course, but the poor guys seem to be always short-staffed compared to the great number of customers in front of them. So here a minus to the Hotel organization and a thumbs up to the staff who keep their smiles and friendliness despite the incredible amount of work. The carpet in the rooms are stained and old (we had 2 rooms and both shared the same kind of carpet, so I believe it is a common feature of the hotel! The lifts are always crowded because they never seem to work all at the same time. This is an issue that most travellers found in many different times so I wonder what is the problem and why it's not fixed. The location is good (if you are after a very tourisy area) and the area is not as rough as it is seems. Personally, if I have the choice I would not go back there

Reviews.Title: “Good location for first timers - many attractions within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: Purple C
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris Gare du Nord around 10.30pm on the Eurostar, and as instructed by my guide book we headed to the right and found the taxi rank outside with barely any queue. Within minutes we were whisked away in a taxi driven by the most delightful Parisian lady to the Novotel Les Halles, - cost around 10 euros. She asked for our hotel address details and typed the area code into her GPS before heading off, so its well worth having that info handy. She was just lovely and pointed out places of interest in reasonably good English. What a great ambassador for Paris this lady was. Her friendliness set the tone for the rest of the holiday. Paris was for us a very welcoming city. Check-in at the Novotel Les Halles was a breeze. We made our best attempt at speaking in French, but the staff are all english speaking and happy to skip between any number of languages. I had been worried about arriving so late, but at least there were no queues. We signed the booking forms and surveyed the lobby and lounge area, picking up a free tourist map of Paris to peruse in our room. A pianist was tinkling the ivories as a few people enjoyed the end of a fine day with a glass of something cool from the bar. I noted that there was a tourist information office just inside the lobby with lots of attraction leaflets on display. It was very useful during our trip to be able ask advice there, although we didn't make use of the booking service. On arrival the teens were tired after our long day of travel so we left them to unpack while we set out to find some takeaway. Mcdonalds of all places was the only takeaway still open at that late hour, so Mcdonalds it had to be! There were a number of pleasant looking restaurants and bars around the fountain square at the rear of the hotel, including of all things, a Pizza Hut. No we would not be going to Pizza Hut this trip! There was a security guard on the door of Mcdonalds and I remembered what I had read on Tripadvisor about the area (Forum Les Halles) seeming threatening at night to one family. To me it seemed delightful and the fountain in the middle of the paved square provided some much needed cool air on a very hot evening. Later in the week we witnessed a few antisocial incidents in the fountain square, and a big scuffle at Mcdonalds when a guy tried to grab the contents of the till without success. Funnily enough the trouble we witnessed in the square was during the day and not at night, but didn't spoil our experience or stop us from eating at a lovely restaurant (Pizzeria Ennio) overlooking the square. We just kept our city street-smarts about us at all times. Pizza and a beer could be had for 11.90 euros. Pizzas were cooked in a traditional brick oven and tasted wonderful. The room was decent enough at around 345 euros a night. I thought from the booking details that we’d have two double beds and two single sofabeds in one big room. What we actually got was a separate double bedroom with triple glazed windows and flat screen TV, and a sitting room/dining area with one double sofabed, and two single sofabeds, an even bigger flat screen TV and a big dining table and chairs. The double bed was amazingly comfortable but the sofabeds were not so great. We all fell in love with the huge walk-in shower with giant shower-head. Weirdly the loo (in its own room) didn’t have a sink or a door lock. The shower room had no door lock either. At times we sat around patiently waiting to wash our hands while others lingered and luxuriated in the shower. Oh well, when in France….. At least the room was clean and well set out, with a lovely little Paris Balcony whose doors were almost permanently open so we could watch the world go by at the front of the hotel. There was no bother with noise at night and we slept like babies despite the hot weather and AC that sometimes struggled a little. The Novotel's proximity to so many lovely areas and attractions was a big bonus (Pompidou Centre, Notre Dame Cathedral, St Germaine, the Louvre, Rue Rivoli) and we did not need to use the metro even once. At 17 euros per person we were never going to have the breakfast, but enjoyed setting out each day to discover the patisseries and cafes on the doorstep. There were plenty of cafe's to choose from plus a couple of grocery stores that came in handy for topping up on sodas, juice and water. The little Monop/Monoprix opposite the Pompidou Centre was a great find for snacks, salads, sandwiches and essentials, but more importantly in such a heatwave, it had brilliant air conditioning! There was also a small grocery store across the road from the hotel which sold individual bottles of chilled soda at 2 euros each, and large bottles of unchilled water also for 2 euros. There was a minibar in the room with tiny bottles of evian water for 4 euros - does anyone seriously use these ridiculous minibars? We would have liked use of a fridge, but didn't dare make use of the minibar for chilling. The staff at reception were great and helped us on a number of occasions with useful advice and also booked our taxi for the return to Gare du Nord on the last day. This time the taxi cost just over 20 euros - twice as much, even though at that time of day the streets were empty and the journey relatively quick. Perhaps it was because we booked through the hotel, but it was much easier than booking it ourselves, so no matter. Check-out was quick and easy and the bill was absolutely spot on. We had booked directly with Novotel and had not used the bar or restaurant during our stay, so there were no additional charges. Apart from the taxi to and from the hotel, the only mode of transport we used during our stay was the batobus - a hop-on hop-off waterbus that cost 12 euros per person per day, or 6 and 8 euros for students and children. There was no commentary on the boat, but the views were brilliant and the crew were a cheery and helpful bunch dispensing travel advice in an impressive selection of languages. The nearest Batobus stops to the hotel were Notre Dame Cathedral and the Louvre - both places a gentle twenty minute stroll from Les Halles. They have a website so you can check the itinerary. We used it to head up the Seine to the Eiffel Tower. All in all a great venue for a first visit to Paris. I would definitely consider staying at Novotel Les Halles again, though next time I quite fancy staying on the left bank as it was so attractive. It's worth noting that Citadines Les Halles was in the same building as the Novotel, though I have no idea what its like inside. ps one of the three lifts was still out of action at the hotel, but hopefully it will be remedied soon. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel choice in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Traveller300163
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, clean and brilliantly located hotel especially for short visits to Paris. All major sight seeing locations are in close reach, partially due to its location, partially due to two Metro-stations within 100-200m of the hotel. Overall the hotel is excellent. The only points of criticism would be that it is difficult to get an elevator in the morning (one out of three was not in use during our stay), bookings are taken WITHOUT breakfast and a breakfast outside the hotel will cost you between 7 - 15 Euros. There are only 2 computer terminals in the bar area, which were usually occupied by (my) children. Check in is not possible before 3 pm, which is a nuisance especially if you arrive in Paris with an early morning or over night flight. Storage of luggage while you wait however is available without an additional charge. Again - overal the hotel is very good, but the above mentioned points could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: zamane
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for 4 nights. The location of the hotel is great ! It is within walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre museum and close to the shopping areas of Galeries La Fayette and the Saint Honore street. The only downside is that in the evenings we heard shouting and loud singing from the outside, making us think that people get drunk in the neighborhood therefore we did not go out around the neighborhood after sunset.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but”
Reviews.Author: jimmyd3
Reviews.Content: a great location near to notre damn and the louvre etc. close to the metro. on direct line from CDG airport.. great friendly and helpful staff who speak good english. tourist info dept on site. plenty of eating places nearby. free internet.. rooms clean. the down side: a heavy police presence at night indicating a probable rough area near the shopping plaza. no air conditioning. the hotel has 3 lifts but you will be lucky if 1 works. breakfast is over priced unless you have 2 children who eat for free (better breakfast available in nearby cafe). hot water not always reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller100
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the Novotel Les Halles with our eight year old granddaughter, who really enjoyed it. The property is well located, within walking distance of many sights, including Notre Dame, the Pompidou Centre and the Louvre. There is a metro and RER entrance (Chatelet) outside the front door. The immediate area is somewhat run down and a touch ‘gritty’ at night. The hotel is high rise - by local norms - and many of the rooms have good views of the city. The décor in the bedrooms is bland but the public areas are more interesting. The atmosphere and service is family friendly and there were lots of children staying during our visit. The buffet breakfast is good but there are too few tables when the hotel is full, so queues develop from about 0830. The staff are helpful and surprisingly cheerful, considering how overworked and multi-tasked they appear to be. Its four star rating is difficult to understand but this hotel is a good - if somewhat expensive - three star and a practical choice for families. Seekers of luxury or glamour should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Superficially fine but poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: talljonny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superficially very nice looking, with contemporary and smart decor...and prices to match. The maintenance was poor tho. Only one of the 3 small lifts worked, so inevitably there were always queues so we used the stairs all weekend. There was a leak in the lobby so buckets and water were laid in front of the lifts. The look of the place was let down by the distinct whiff of sewers on the gound floor, which may explain why I saw no-one dining in the restauant. Our friends had to change rooms as theirs smelled of sewers (on the 5th floor!) and smoke, the toilet was in bits and the room was tiny. Their next room was very spacious and had a great view (as did ours) but the toilet wouldnt stop running. Wasnt worth the price, but would have been if the place was in functioning order!

Reviews.Title: “no problems - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: brandenburg5
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and, considering the good deal I got online for it, I think it was good value. My room was very stuffy and I was told that the system hadn't switched over from heating to air-conditioning yet. The room looked out on the atrium so the window was locked. But I was then offered a room on the opposite side, so I could get fresh air from the unlocked window. The room itself was fine, bathroom and plumbing fine, corridors didn't smell. The only real inconvenience was the elevators - one of the three didn't work at all, and the other two were sometimes very slow to arrive. Many people took to using the stairs instead. I tried the breakfast one day but found it overpriced at 17 euros. There was a large basket of eggs next to a pile of disposable egg cups. When I cracked my egg I found that it was raw! I think the eggs were meant to be boiled to order, but no one had set up the egg cooker! So, after that, it was definitely breakfast out. I also had a dinner here, which was pretty good. I found the service and attitude here very good - helpful, professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Pity about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leas-Cliff
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer commented, the hotel is very conveniently located with both RER and the Metro interchange within the Les Halles Forum. Shopping & transport is therefore literally on your doorstep. Bars, brasseries and restaurants are again all within walking distance. Close to Hotel de Ville, Notre Dame and the Louvre. However, that is all on the ‘plus’ side. The hotel itself lets its great location down by the bucket load. For some unknown reason, The Novotel Paris Les Halles chooses to describe itself as one of a few Novotel’s in France that has been awarded four stars. There is an air of grubbiness as soon as you approach the forecourt of the hotel. That goes with the general location of the area but still no reason why no general maintenance or daily wash down is not carried out. Once inside the hotel the lobby and public areas look well maintained but it is the sometimes lack of staffing to greet and meet that makes it look unmanaged. Multi tasking may be the name of the game nowadays but there is no obvious discipline as to which member of staff is supposed to be doing what; check in, check out, enquiries, concierge etc? The three tiny lifts are slow and totally impractical for the size of the hotel and for ‘added’ security also require the guest to swipe the room card to call the lift. But in typically French fashion whilst this may deter most undesirables off the street from gaining access to the upper floors, they can still sneak in when a lift arrives and its passengers get out. The floor corridors smell of goodness knows what and even our non smoking room had obviously had smokers using them. Has the hotel never heard of using air fresheners to at least mask those smells? The rooms are of reasonable size and in fairly good condition with the exception of our last room where the wooden skirting was brown with damp that was leaking through from the shower behind it. The air conditioner was not working in that it could only push out warm air. The toilet was badly lit and lacked good ventilation. Bathroom was in good order but suffered from bad plumbing which meant when you emptied the hand basin the waste strainer in the shower tray was forced out. This with the added bonus of having old sludge blowing back through the shower tray was gross!
