We had to remember that any wake up calls we booked with reception had to be timed for 15 minutes ahead of your actual requirement as the system (even though it was reported) was still running 15 minutes late on our last day The bar area is comfortable if small for the number of rooms but okay for a quick drink. The breakfasts even though it was not taken on this last visit, are in my opinion, overpriced, sometimes chaotic (room not big enough for size hotel perhaps?) and under managed and better to avoid as there is a very nice Paul’s boulangerie around the corner where you can get a continental breakfast for half the price of the 17 euros that the Novotel does. By the way, its 15.30 euros at the Novotel down by the Eiffel Tower. The Novotel Paris Les Halles is obviously for one or two night tour operators and conventions which looks like the mainstay of this particular hotel's business and the independent traveller is probably better off finding somewhere else for their stay in Paris. At best it is a three star hotel masquerading to be a four star and it is as another reviewer, suggests, worth avoiding like the plague especially for what they are charging. A shame and Accor should be aware that it lets its branding down, but then they are getting 'bums on beds' so what the hell do they care?

Reviews.Title: “Novot hell - Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: jarrodaston
Reviews.Content: In typical Paris fashion once again we were very disappointed with our accommodation. Having stayed at the awful Le Meridien Etoile the previous year we hoped that Novotel would prove a better choice. NOT! We booked a "Junior Suite/Family Room". We arrived at a hotel with one person doing check in (there were about 5 families waiting in line). Our room was tiny with a double bed and two pull out couch beds. The double bed was typical of something you would sleep on in a hospital or hostel. Terrible, uncomfortable and quite disappointing. The hotel lacks any soul, has terrible smells emanating from who knows where. Although it's billed as a 4-Star hotel it is probably a 3-Star at best. No concierge either? And no porter to assist with luggage? The only redeeming feature of this hotel is its position. Close to the Louvre and Metro, thanks goodness we spent most our time sightseeing. The local area is a bit seedy too. We felt a little scared coming back in the early evening and walking from the Metro to the hotel, only a few minutes walk. Avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Kylie71
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children recently stayed at this hotel ( 29Dec 07 - 1 Jan 08). The location of the hotel is very convenient especially for access to train and the surrounding sites of Paris eg: Lourve. On arrival the check in staff were most helpful and allowed us to check in early which was greatly appreciated. The room was a little dissappointing as it was smaller than others we had stayed in on our european holiday- Double with sofa bed. With the sofa bed out it left little room for luggage and we felt a bit crampt. The breakfast, whilst quite expensive at 16 Euros per adult we felt was worth the cost as our children ate free. Going downstairs for breakfast was easier and more convenient and ensured we were well fed for our days adventures. Make sure you dine early as it gets quite busy and there can often be a wait. Our children especially liked the free computers and internet access in the downstairs lobby. Overall we were satisfied with our choice of hotel and its location at this busy time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Happily Suprised by Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithFriday
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with this hotel - it was part of a package and I was a bit wary. However, the lobby and breakfast area are quite lovely and my room on the 8th floor had amazing views - the Sacre Coeur in the distance and St. Eustache just below. The room had a sitting area with big windows and the bedroom area had a sliding glass door. First night in I had room service - quite good! The staff was friendly and helpful, the location steps from about anything/everything you could want to find in Paris. While it may not be the fabulous little gem on the other side of the river we all hope to find, the Novotel is a great choice at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scanvest
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel for a Family Birthday weekend and must say that we were very disappointed. The Novotel Paris les Halles is really only suited as a budget business hotel, not for a nice romantic getaway. The whole hotel has a dated late-80s feel to it. Location The location is fine, with minutes from Paris Les Halles, Centre Pompidou and La Cite. Rooms & Amenities The rooms are in desperate need of an overhaul; it seems that apart from the lobby area, the hotel was renovated in the early nineties. The carpets and beds are threadbare, the bathrooms old and scuffed, the TVs small, the whole place feels neglected. There are a bar and a restaurant also, and a reasonably nice lounge area. Breakfast Breakfast has a poor choice, and unless you come very early, you are likely to wait for 20minutes to be given a table, as there are not enough tables to service more than a third of the residents and there seem to be no staff around to clear used tables. Service staff seem helpless and confused, half the tea/coffee machines are usually out of order. Service and staff Check-in and check-out are okay; on checking out, we were given our room as a day-room at not extra charge. Concierge is great, very helpful and knowledgeable. This hotel is only really acceptable as a budget hotel, with 2 to 3-star feel to it. It is certainly no 4-star hotel, and at the prices being charged, it is a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChloeAthens
Reviews.Content: All in all we had a pleasant stay at this hotel. Our room was clean, quiet, modern and tastefully decorated. However there were a few problems. Although there is a temperature dial in the room, the temperature is centrally controlled, making the quilts they have on the beds far too heavy, and you, helpless to turn the temperature down, in order to get a good night's sleep. At other times the room is too cold to walk around in without having something long-sleeved on. The dining room is too small for the number of rooms at the hotel. At around 9.00 a.m. there is a long queue of people lining up to have breakfast, and waiting for someone to finish. (Which is something I've never seen before). Get in early! Also I don't think the breakfast is worth the 16 euros they charge. The eggs and bacon were always cold. But the fact that they offer free breakfast for children made it attractive to us. And convenient. We found the hotel food to be good, and preferred room service to the mediocre restaurants around the hotel. The hotel is centrally located and across from a train station, however being a family of four, it was actually cheaper for us to take taxis. Train fares are exorbitantly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuslac
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nicely located next to Metro station. Rooms where average sized, quiet, modern and very clean. Bed was very comfortable. Hotel employees where very nice and helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unwanted surprises at Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Luxotraveller
Reviews.Content: Novotel Les Halles has the perfect location in Paris, but prices are also so steep that I haven’t stayed there for many years. However, just ahead of my last trip, I changed my reservation to Novotel, because I learned from Tripadvisor that the hotel that I had initially booked had its reception a flight of stairs up and also had had problems with their elevators. My travel companion had (fortunately temporary) reduced mobility and we didn’t want to risk anything. A Novotel for me is a no-glamour but a no-surprise experience, and that’s why it can be worth to pay a premium compared to other hotels of the same class. First surprise, at 12.30, only two persons in this 300 room hotel were working to handle the enormous queues of hotel guests checking in and out, including the baggage storage room quite far away. After a half-an-hour’s wait, I got the message, like the guests before me, that the room would not be available until 3pm, as was officially stated. The advantage of a big hotel is usually that they can handle the flux of hotel guests coming in and out without sticking to official rules. Second surprise, the nice French windows that all the rooms seem to have were lacking in our room, being placed in a middle section, with only a small window which was not possible to open. (The congested bathroom sink was actually no surprise at all, having stayed in so many Paris hotels of all classes). At this point of the day, we hadn’t had the real surprise yet, since elevators were quite busy, taking people down all the time, so we didn’t get aware of the problem that was announced on a piece of paper, namely that the mechanism for calling the elevator with the hotel card was out of order. We learned that from a surly night receptionist, who asked us to walk up the stairs o the first floor to call the elevator, increasing his voice and switching to English, when we stood there hesitant how to handle the situation. Since my friend had me to do this for him, the situation was never alarming, but it was exactly the kind of situation we had expected to avoid by staying in a Novotel. The problem hadn’t solved when we left, probably for ever, Sunday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Les Halles was fine”
Reviews.Author: Cloverbeak
Reviews.Content: I had difficulty finding a well-located affordable hotel for my family of four in Paris and since it was July, I was concerned about stifling, hot weather. Most of the affordable hotels that accommodated families did not have air-conditioning. So, I opted for the Novotel Les Halles, which was air-conditioned and was comparably priced. At the hotel, our original room, which slept only three, was too small for a family of four. We were graciously upgraded to a far superior room. I have no complaints about the staff -- they were perfectly pleasant. However, had I the chance to do it over again, I would opt for a neighborhood and hotel with more personality. Yes, it was well-located and reasonably comfortable, but it was really not a very memorable experience. The lines in the morning for the buffet breakfast were sometimes unpleasantly long as was the wait for the elevator. As it turned out, it was cool and rainy the week we were in Paris and we would have been fine at a smaller hotel with less amenities. Despite my feelings, I would recommend this hotel to people who seek a central location and predictability of staying at a chain hotel. For families, it represents a good value -- especially if you pay in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect Location - good Familly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: highflyin
Reviews.Content: Stay here for a week with my familly 2 adults and 2 children aged 3 and 8. Used it as a base for exploring all the Paris sites and a trip to Disneyland. It's about the best price / location you can get for a familly. Lots of restaurants within 2-3 mins walking distance. Walking distance to the sites 5-30 mins or take a bus / underground. 30 mins drive to Disneyland or tak the train (15mins) from right outside the hotel. Great tip is take the tourist open top sight seeing bus (5 mins from hotel) and use this as transport to the sites. I've stayed in Paris many times and these familly rooms are large although a little shabby. It has a great location for food, sites, Disney that you forgive a little shabbyness in the rooms. It also has great and very secure underground car-park, from where you can unload the car and take luggage direct to the room. This is much beter than the more central hotels (central meaning Arc de Triumph) due to price, familly friendly etc. There were lots of Spanish and Italian families when were there. Abosultely recommended. Will go back, to use as a base for Disneyland rather than using the expensive Disneyland resort hotels. Plus you can stay right in Paris rather than in the middle of theme park !

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Last_travel_bug
Reviews.Content: Generally acceptable for Paris with a good location and close to major sites and Metro. Room quality satisfactory and reasonabilly clean. Carpets seems too thin. Staff efficient and well verse in english. Hotel ideal for North American tourist who cares more for cleanliness and efficiency than experience true French experience. I happened to fall into this category. Note to North American tourist visiting Paris, the washrooms in lots of places are in poor shape, poor maintenance, shared toilets, lots of times - no toilet seats even at the Musee du Louvre Museum - both for the men and women toilets! Generally, the major public sites including Versailles, Eiffel Tower, are very poorly organised and lack of proper toilets and facilities. Watch out for puddles near walls in every area - people urinate everywhere including in front of crowds!!! Subways - Metro and RER train service are excellent except that they do not have good instructions and signs!! If you are not in good shape, some of the stairs in the stations can be hard on those who are not fit or handicap. Food generally is expensive compared to North America especially at the tourist sites or flashy sites with neon lights. Forget about American style of breakfast - or coffee unless you can find McD or Starbuck. Coke or soft drinks are very expensive and NO seconds! Food at the tourist areas are generally expensive from 15 euro to 25 euros for 3 course meals. I do not mind the price but the quality is not as good at our typical North American restaurants. For better and cheaper food, go away from the main drag and into the alleys and not too flash restaurants. Paris is a great place to visit at least once in a lifetime, but unless it improves and change for the better, this maybe the last visit for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Typical large group hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Grux
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a Eurostar package for three adults. We arrived at approx 1030 but were told we could not check in until 1500. A check-in time so late is pretty poor form. They did have a luggage room that was kept under lock and key and all bags were tagged. We at least had some piece of mind from this as we left our luggage to explore Paris. Check in staff were not very friendly and supplied a room for two despite our booking stating a party of three. This was then rectified when we pointed out the error. When we were able to get into the room we found it had been stocked for two and had to call for additional towels etc. The room was your the standard norm for a large chain hotel. It was clean and comfortable. We did not try the breakfast as it was not part of our package. The best thing about the hotel is its location. If you arrive on the Eurostar it is easily and quickly reached on the RER (train). It also has a Metro stop very close by. The hotel is within walking distance to The Lourve and Notre Dame and if you lean out of the window (of a front room) it is possible to catch a glimpse of The Eiffel Tower :) Overall it was what we expected, not amazing though not too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: envgeo
Reviews.Content: I purchased 4 nights via price line and got a great deal. I think it has all been said before, but here it goes anyway -rooms are clean and functionable. -the location to the sites and the metro is fantastic -there are a few good restaurants a short walk from the hotel (we ate at a Moroccan place that was good) -there are some nice walking streets just on the other side of St. Eustice church. We did not know that till the second of the last day and there are some great pastry shops and bistros over there -it is a little sketchy at night towards the Pompidou center, but there are plenty of police around - Breakfast was expensive and not really worth it I am not sure if this has been mentioned before, but there is a tourist information office in the lobby. We bought our Paris Musee pass from there and they charged my room (no extra fees).

Reviews.Title: “Family of four”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandNetty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3nights while sightseeing Paris - room was adequate for our family with a large teenager and 10 year old. Breakfast was plentiful but quite busy so worth getting there early. Good location as you can walk to the Louvre, Pompidou easily. Had an evening meal in restaurant and compared to Paris prices it was quite good value. Surrounding area very busy with shops although a few undesirables hanging around although this seems fairly common thoughtout Paris. Would recommend this hotel for the fact it had a fairly large family room.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel and Location - don't be put off by comments about area”
Reviews.Author: Canuck065
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - booked it directly from their website and got a great deal so long as I was willing to forgo cancelation insurance which I was. Was there with family of 4 - two kids 10 and 11 - for 3 nights. All in one room easily. Room was great for what we wanted - a place to sleep while we saw Paris. Close to everything - eating, sights, metro, etc. 1 simple RER to the CDG airport. We bought breakfast at grocery and pastry shop across the street ... and ate in room with coffee made with the in room coffee maker. Was concerned about the area given other postings, but absolutely no issues. We came back one evening at midnight coming back from the effiel tower (specular at night at the top). Great restaurant district only a short walk away. Kids also enjoyed the free internet to email friends. Exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel close to transportation hub”
Reviews.Author: bzflyer
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location: Train from CDG Airport stops right under the hotel. Area around the hotel deteriorated over the last few years, so please be careful walking around. But few blocks away, in a tourist areas, it is safe. Hotel is well secured with 24/7 security and key-blocked elevators. Rooms are ok, but pillow are poliester, and mattress is foam. Service is lousy: It took us 1.5 hours to get a third pillow (!); staff did not speak English; there were no extra toothbrushes in the housekeeping. For the price - $260 - the hotel is a low value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PA_Family-Travels
Reviews.Content: We were here for three days with three girls (16, 13, and 8). The location is wonderful. Easy walk to Notre Dame, Louvre, Centre Pompido and the Metro. There are also lots of stores located at Les Halles. The rooms were nice and clean. It is a larger hotel with 30 or 40 rooms on a floor. The staff was very pleasant. The only negative was a recommendation from the information/conciere to take a dinner cruise down the Seine. Very over priced and definately not appropriate for children.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice people”
Reviews.Author: TripfamIly2012
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our trip to Europe and were pleased with our stay here from June 10-13th. As you can imagine, the room was not terribly large (the photos posted are about the same as our room), but they are clean and in good repair. The staff were quite pleasant and helpful, particularly the night staff. The location was very good, less than one block from the nearest Metro station (Chatelet - make sure you exit from the Lingerie entrance when you arrive at night, the Chatalet station is quite large as it is a major station, there are many exits). Most stations have an elevator for handicapped which helps when you're burdened with luggage. We stayed 4 nights initially, then an additional 5th night when we missed our train. We returned to the hotel at 10:30pm and were initially told the hotel was full, but then they made an accommodation for us and gave us the previous Priceline price we had paid for the previous 4 nights, which was a very nice surprise. Our first room was comparable to the ones in the photo, the second room (5th night) was not in quite as good shape, but acceptable. I think they are renovating the rooms in blocks and are only partially completed. The hotel also has a Paris Information office where they can help with plane reservations/reconfirmations, subway, train transportation as well as the usual tour info and is staffed by helpful and nice people. I would stay at this hotel again, and do recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: welovefrance7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last December (27th - 2nd Jan) and was a little apprehensive as some reviews seemed to imply it was quite average. When we arrived however, we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is a stones throw from the train station which was great after a rather tiring eurostar journey with two small children. The problem with the french metro, it does not take in to consideration people who have children in pushchairs, doubles ones at that! My husband carried our huge double buggy up at least ten flights of stairs, so it was a big relief when we finally emerged from the metro to be faced with the hotel. We found the hotel to be clean and the staff friendly. Buffett breakfast was very good by french standards, the bar menu very over priced (as always) but the evening meals not so expensive and good value. You dont need to worry however as you are in a haven of great french bistro's and Italian restaurants catering for all tastes. There is a starbucks just around the corner from the hotel and it is twice as good as ours here in England. It was open all hours and was nice to pick up hot chocolate and donuts for the kids on the way back to the hotel in the evening. The location of the hotel in general is perfect for shopping and sightseeing. You are a five minute walk from the Notre Dame and Seine and we even walked to the Eiffel Tower on New Years Eve, where we watched it light up in the dusk from a small cafe across the street. I love Paris, summer, spring and now in the Winter. It was freezing cold but it did not marr out enjoyment. The Novotel is a good base for exploring the city. If I had to mention any negative areas it would be the lifts! Painstakingly slow!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: vASSILIKI
Reviews.Content: Location was great with many major attractions within walking distance. The room was clean, spacious enough to accommodate 3 people, especially by Paris standards, and quiet (our room was on the 5th floor). Staff was polite and helpful. The surrounding area felt safe enough to walk back to the hotel late at night. Did not have any meals at the hotel as there are many bakeries and bistros in the area. Overall, it was very good value for money (we paid $165 per night through Priceline) and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a short break”
Reviews.Author: lucylettuce
Reviews.Content: I booked via hotel site, as it was the cheapest rate I found. Hotel way exceeded expectations. Travelled with 9 and 11 year old, and they each had a single bed which folded down from sofa. Room was far bigger than any other I'd stayed in, and clean and comfortable. For the quality of the place, it was certainly value for money . Breakfasts were fine, but they were a bit slow restocking. I'd been apprehensive about location, but we found it to be fantastic. So many places were within a short walking distance, and we did not feel at all threatened . There was a strong police presence around the hotel. The staff were very helpful, and all spoke good English. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyfletcher46
Reviews.Content: We've just returned after a 2 night stay at this hotel. We had a deluxe room overlooking the Forum des Halles and St Eustache church. The room was modern, clean and well kept. I don't know what other contributors are complaining about. We found the hotel staff to be friendly, helpful and polite. Breakfast was substantial and included in our rate of 172€ per night. The hotel is not cheap, but this is central Paris after all. The area is well served with restaurants and bars, so you don't have to eat in the hotel restaurant if you don't want to. The hotel is well situated, only 2 blocks or so from the Rue de Rivoli and the Louvre. There is a Metro station (Chatelet), which makes access to all of Paris's sights easily accessible. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very central but overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanreynolds
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights Thursday and Friday 3 and 4 May 2007. As others have commented, the hotel is very centrally situated being in the Les Halles district and within walking distance of Pompidou Centre. It is at the busy Chatelet RER station with connections to lines A and B as well as to several metro lines. Come out / Enter via the Berger exit (follow Forum Les Halles and then Lescot signs) until about 20.00 and then use the Lescot exit about 100 metres away. The hotel is on 6 storeys and of modern design and construction. I had room 654, which was spacious and overlooked the street entrance (ie not Les Halles rear entrance) but was surprisingly quiet due to good double glazing. The room had large comfortable double bed with duvet, settee and desk. Bathroom and WC were separate. There were the customary thin plastic beakers, rather than glass tumblers in the room and bathroom. Breakfast restaurant and bar are on ground floor. The former is bright and spacious but could not cope with a full hotel on my first morning. There were not enough staff to clear tables, and queues built up despite tables being unoccupied. Food quality was modest (machine dispensed orange juice) and selection poor (oranges, apples and grapefuit the only cut fruit; and various English-looking cheeses in slices the only cheeses). I felt that €13 was too expensive. As in the Novotel in Lille, I felt the chain is skimping on its breakfasts (as well as on its plastic beakers). My room was not ready for my pre-advised arrival time of noon, even though my Frequent customer card should have signalled I was a regular customer in group hotels. All in all, I was only moderately satisfied. But as the hotel was full, the hotel may think it does not need to do better.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: hisredhead
Reviews.Content: The only points I can give this hotel are for location and working air conditioning in July. It was fabulous being such a short walk from the Louvre, the Notre Dame, the Hotel de Ville, and Musee d'Orsay. We stayed for 2 nights the first weekend in July 2006 and could not have gotten worse service. The room was never cleaned. My biggest problem was wanting to take a shower after touristing under the July sun and finding massive amounts of MILDEW in the shower. It was not cleaned the entire time we were there even though we complained twice. My husband complained that the bed was much too stiff, but we are used to a double pillowtop mattress at home. Our room also didn't have an alarm clock (as their website said it would) & all of our wake up calls were "forgotten" by the staff. If you're willing to exchange the frills and clean shower for location, by all means stay here...but they won't see us again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan1999
Reviews.Content: If you like a very modern, spacious and friendly hotel, do not look further! We had a perfect 3 day stay! The Metro and large station is just a minute or two's walk away, it is located in a great, vibrant and safe area near the river and the hotel staff are friendly – what more can you ask for? The reception area is comfy and beautiful with nice fresh flowers everywhere. Our room was large with a lovely bathroom consisting of a shower AND a bath tub with the toilet in a separate room: Fantastic! - you do not even find this in an expensive 5 star hotel. Breakfast was a bit pricey but we did our own thing. The view from our bedroom was great - see two photos attached. Two thumbs up in all respects for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: wellersky
Reviews.Content: We were staying in this Hotel on a 1 night break to Paris. The room was clean, modern and a good size. The position of the Hotel was perfect. Even the usually sourly customer service you would generally expect from the French was not in existance. The staff were very helpful and did not even question me when I asked for my mini bar bill to be removed as it had been added by accident (our fault). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: ShantaNottingham
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay in smart, clean, comfortable room, looking out onto lovely view of St Eustache church and gardens of Les Halles. Location afforded easy walking to Pompidou Centre, Louvre Hotel de Ville, Seine and access to RER / Metro just opposite hotel. Lots of interesting and lively streets to explore within the vacinity. Staff helpful and friendly, buffet breakfast very good. Drinks in hotel expensive though and mini bar 3 times the cost of same item purchased outside. Recommended as a great base for on foot access to central Paris sights.

Reviews.Title: “SO-SO”
Reviews.Author: howrd23
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip w/ a friend who bought a BMW in Munich and so we drove to paris and had the car sent to U.S. from there. Hotel had parking in center of city for 25 bucks a day about. When we checked in, we asked for two beds, they said no. We stayed at hotel for about a week. It was okay, nothing special. NO GYM. The restaurant is expensive and food is lousy. The service isn't very friendly either. The waiters were kind of rude and took forever to get a drink at the bar. There are MANY bad restaurants in this area of Paris so beware where you go. DO NOT GO to the restaurant near les Halles called L'Entrecote which is just near this hotel!!! You WILL get food poisoning and if you think people are rude in Paris, this is surely the best (worst) spot to witness this. We had an awful experience at this restaurant from the food the service the check the smoking etc. I love the les halles area as it is very crowded w/ people, just try to get recommendations where to eat. There are many gay bars nearby but if you don't smoke, its kind of gross. For the price, the hotel is okay but i would look for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: henryjames
Reviews.Content: Ideally placed for touristy city breaks, max 10 min walk to louvre / isle de la cité / centre pompidou etc. Comfortable and pretty smart, but in a chain-like way (it is a Novotel after all...). Very clean and quiet. Walk-up prices are crazy (350 eur) but online pretty good value (max half that), esp with kids as they stay (and eat breakfast) for free, in rooms plenty big enough to sleep 4. Helpful staff. Be sure to exit Chatelet Les Halles at Porte Berger or you'll be wandering around all over trying to find it.... The immediately surrounding area is pretty lively at night, but perfectly safe. (Rooms are quiet.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rescue”
Reviews.Author: JLaur78
Reviews.Content: Novotel was a wonderful rescue from an internet reservation gone wrong. We had reserved a room at Hotel Saint Honore just steps away. That hotel turned out to be horrible. We needed another hotel and fast. Novotel had a room for us thank goodness! Our room was beautiful! It was very new, clean, and modern. They must have been remodeling room. Our room was new! The lobby was beautiful and the staff friendly and helpful. Excellent area and so much to do. Right by Chatlet Metro. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sparks!
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 9-12 Jan. I found the hotel very good by Paris standards. I did hear some construction but that was near the elevator and my room was on the opposite side of the hotel. My room (530) was immaculate with a redone bathroom, large bed, seating area and windows that overlooked Les Halles and the park. Location is great. Metro right out the door, on the B3 line to CDG airport, 10 minute walk to either Notre Dame or the Louvre, lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Windows opened completely so you can let in fresh air whenever you want. Be careful if you put things in the fridge, it automatically deducts any items you move. I had no problem getting the 8 euros a day (moved a couple juices) removed from my hotel bill. There are a couple markets nearby if you want to stock up on cheese, bread, wine, whatever. Staff spoke English and were helpful. Did not use the restaurant for breakfast (why would you with so many choices right outside your door for less?). I would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: gwrjack
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Paris. We stayed at the Novotel Les Halles and had a great time. This is a very nice modern hotel and very well placed for the metro. The train from the airport takes you to Les Halles and it is a very short walk from there to the hotel. Also very easy to walk around the area and lots of shops and restaurants nearby. We walked over to the other side of the river and went to jazz clubs in the evening which were fantastic and did the galleries during the day. The pompidou centre is a short stroll from the hotel and the musee d'orsay easy to reach by metro. All in all an excellent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Les Halles is a busy area but there were lots of police on duty and we felt very safe walking back late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a geat location !”
Reviews.Author: witsendguesthouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Les Halles from December 27 2006 to January 2, 2007. The hotel is new and modern. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Fortunately for me they spoke English very well ! Since every square foot costs a fortune in Paris, the hotel room was very small. Having said that, it was designed very well. Lighting was excellent, modern business desk, hassle-free access to the internet, separate washroom and bathroom, queen size bed consisted of 2 singles pushed together. Our daughter slept on a pull-out sofa. Both beds were comfortable. The room had a coffee and tea maker, a safe (which was VERY handy), plenty of closet space, mini-bar and climate control. Just outside the hotel you will find any number of small cafe's, shops, outdoor market stalls and of course the Forum, the hub of the Metro and RER. Just one street over is a small super market. MacDonald and Pizza Hut are right around the corner for those who crave something familiar. Our favourite were the little stalls on the sidewalks where they would bake crepes and gyros. A short walk away and you are at the Notre Dame and Saint Germaines des Pres, walking distance to the Louvre, Les Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. Must take metro RER to the Champ de Mars/Eiffel Tower. We enjoyed staying in the Novotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst than the cheapest motel”
Reviews.Author: tagliot
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 151.from the website the hotel looks really modern and nicely designed. the lobby is nice, but when you get to the room, don't expect more than the a $30 motel room. very small room, utilitarian design (I mean I like modern, clean design, this was utilitarian - broken Formica, cheap furniture...). Tiny toilet room with toilet paper holder with a lock on it! as if people there have a tendency to steal toilet paper from a 200+ Euro room! of coarse - expensive Internet connection and limited TV channel selection. service: the worst I have seen in any European hotel. I am really low maintenance, all I needed is to press my shirts and take cash out of my credit card (Amex) - could not get help on either. in summary: very bad value for the money. you can do better in much cheaper hotels. don't get fooled by the glossy website.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Tejas1
Reviews.Content: After a week of staying in a variety of "charming' hotels in northern France (superior on the views, not so impressive on the space and amenities), I have to admit -- at the risk of sounding provincial -- that the Novotel Les Halles was such a welcome oasis for the last leg of our trip in Paris. Yes, it is part of a chain, but with that, you can expect a sizeable room, a lusciously comfortable bed, a flat-screen tv, and a coffee/tea maker. What's not to like, I ask? The bonus is that mere steps from the front of the hotel is an elevator that takes you down to the Chatelet RER and straight to Charles de Gaulle airport. It is supremely convenient. I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can get the deal we did - Priceline at 120 USD per night.

Reviews.Title: “Such a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth26
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews I was a bit sceptical about this hotel however I believe it is great for a weekend. ALthough we did pay a very low price as booked through priceline. Location - the location is great as if you leave from Exit 10 at Chatelet les Halles you arrive outside the hotel. This is so convienient as is on the RER B which takes you straight back to the airport. The area around the hotel did not feel dodgy at all, moreover there are loads of bars and restaurants right on your doorstep, perfect if you arrive late. We didn;t bother with breakfast in the hotel as there are many cafes where you can get breakfast cheaply on the hotels doorstep. Room: The room is minimalist as are all Novotel so not plush luxury, however it was comfortable, quiet and had obviously recently been refurbished - I wonder if from some of the reviews if only part of the hotel has been refurbished. All in all would happily stay again - in fact I am taking a business customer to Paris in the next few weeks and plan to stay as it is so convienient and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: blacklab
Reviews.Content: I very regularly go to Paris for business and always stay at the Novotel. If you wish to see several clients a day and therefore prefer the métro, this is THE place for you. The busy Châtelet métro station is only a few steps from the hotel. Rooms are spacious, quiet and clean - it is true what another member said about the hot water (not always warm enough, especially in the morning). You must understand the Novotel system with the beds: There are no twin beds, only one (fairly wide) bed. But the sofa turns into a second bed if you are not used to sharing - do not hesitate to convert it into a bed, it is easy and ready for use. The only complaint I have about this hotel is the breakfast, but they do warn you in the lifts. Have it before 7.30 a.m. if possible - beyond this time, it is a real problem to get a table. Very friendly staff and nice bar with a good bar pianist. While some people may find the area a bit seedy, I like the huge shopping mall adjacent to the hotel and the large number of restaurants. A room easily sleeps four if you come with your kids, because of the extra bed mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: paulmar
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel or the location. If you want to be in the centre of a large city and surrounded by shops and restaurants within a few steps of the Louvre, Notre Dame and the Seine, then this place is hard to beat. Inevitably you will see people alot less fortunate than oneself sleeping rough but no one bothered us at all. No complaints at all with the room and having a court yard view meant it was lovely and quiet. We ate in the restaurant one night and the food was excellent. However Au Pied de Cochon across the square near the St Eustache church is a must. Be prepared to queue as this place is popular and you will see why! We would certainly stay at this hotel again and recommend it to friends and clients.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; questionable location”
Reviews.Author: Bair
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be of high quality. The room was well appointed with good quality fittings and bathroom. The air conditioning was adequate and the room was well cleaned each day. Meals at the hotel were reasonably priced and appropriate for a good family hotel. The dining room was popular and busy. Staff were courteous. Our great disappointment was the surrounding environment. Outside the hotel the amount of litter is appalling and homeless people sleep in adjacent doorways, visible from the hotel room. Guests of the hotel need to be vigilant of pick-pockets when leaving the hotel. I was grabbed and robbed in broad daylight soon after I left the front door of the hotel and walked across the square towards the underground station. We were very glad that the hotel room had a good safe for valuables!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Novotel Les Halles”
Reviews.Author: orimeep
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Novotel Les Halles and I really enjoyed it. It is convenient to where I need to be in Paris for business (around the corner) which is why I booked it the first time, but I was happy to return there this week. The rooms are spacious and clean, the bed is comfortable, and I personally really like the Novotel decoration style (someone else described it as resembling Ikea, but I guess I like that somewhat minimalist look). The breakfast is a little over priced at 16 Euro, but high speed internet was free, so I considered it a wash (actually, internet often costs more than 16 Euro so I guess I really saved money in the end). The staff was also very friendly. They gave me a great recommendation for a restaurant my first night in town - it was just around the corner and I thought it was really good. It was called "Au Chien Qui Fume" and I had a really yummy onion soup and a good steak there. I would definitely recommend it to others! The Novotel certainly isn't a luxury hotel, but I always have gotten great rates on their website and found that I have gotten more than my money's worth!
